title: Internship: Inteligent VA - Junior scraper (Long term employment)
description:
We are an affordable web development agency that serves small entrepreneurs.

Especially those who dont have websites, or have bad, outdated, non functional etc. websites and cant afford expensive solutions.



JOB DESCRIPTION:

- You will create and maintain a system which pulls into a spreadsheet data like company name, city, phone number,
 address, their website, FB page, etc.

- We dont care whether you code it in Python, use Google scripts, or any AI - all we care is the results.

- IMPORTANT: We will be doing that by "profession+city" and repeat many, many, many many times. Each country has e.g. some 100 counties, and like 100 professions. So one country alone would be like doing the same task 10 thousand times. 

Therefore - you are in charge of creating, maintaining and enhancing the automation system.

- Look, this is simplified example, but: Go ahead, try to GPT something like: "electricians in Davao". GPT refuses giving you all e.g. 200 of them at once. It gives you some 10, then another 10, etc. And since we will need all kinds of others, like hair dressers, plumbers, etc etc, in many different cities - its impossible to create manually. And thats what u are here for.



REQUIREMENTS:

Intelligence. Once you got that - you can use GPT or Gemini to find out ways how to solve problems.





Payout every Friday in PHP or crypto.

More simple tasks follow, depending on your skills.



Pros: Junior position, hired in a day, opportunity to get a long-term job and being the company integral part in systems development or other departments.

Cons: We are on a tight budget.



More info?

Dont send CVs or the generic fluff you are sending to everyone.

Either mention something very related to this job or
 us empty message at: 
 will get you the details immediately.

title: Executive Operations Assistant
description:
Position: Operations & Admin Assistant (Highly Detail-Oriented / Systems-Driven)

Remote | Beginning Part-Time (20–30 hrs/week to start) then ramp up to Full-Time

Compensation: I reward hard-working, competent employees! There is no "max" earning with this role- the more experience, accuracy, effort, and drive you have, the more you will earn. 



Hi!!! My name is Mel, and I own the top Christian speed-dating services in the United States! I’m on the lookout for a new assistant to grow with me. There are countless opportunities for growth, and I’m so excited to find the right person to join the team. I currently have two AMAZING assistants and need a third to keep up with the growth we've been experiencing. Here's a testimonial from one of my assistants:



"I’ve been working as Mel's VA since September 2024, and I genuinely love it. The work is meaningful (helping people find their Godly spouses), fast-paced, and never boring. You’re supporting a business that’s actively scaling. Mel is professional, clear, and respectful of boundaries. I can fully enjoy my days off, travel when needed, and never worry about work piling up. She also pays weekly and always on time. That said, a great client is great for a reason. This role requires great - truly GREAT - attention to detail. Mel has high standards, and rightfully so. If you’re not detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to doing excellent work, this won’t be the right fit. But if you are, working with her is incredibly fulfilling. I’m grateful to be part of her team and to support a leader who is clear, mission-driven, and genuinely good to work with."



Please read carefully before applying



This role is not creative, not social-media strategy, and not “wing-it” work.

This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys:

• Following detailed SOPs

• Working from templates

• Tracking numbers

• Executing conditional logic accurately

• Catching mistakes before they happen

• Doing important but sometimes tedious admin work extremely well



If you are not naturally obsessive about details, this role will feel overwhelming.



About the Role:



We run highly organized, multi-city events with complex ticket logic, conditional
 workflows, and time-sensitive admin tasks. One small mistake can create downstream issues, so precision matters. You will be responsible for executing systems exactly as documented, while also helping improve them over time once you fully understand how everything works. This is a self-directed remote role with clear expectations, clear SOPs, and recurring tasks.



Core Responsibilities:



Admin & Operations (High Attention to Detail)

• Perform data entry and tracking using Google Sheets and internal spreadsheets

• Monitor ticket inventory levels across:

• Men’s tickets

• Women’s tickets

• 1-man + 1-woman tickets

• 2-men combo tickets

• 3-men combo tickets

• Ensure events stay balanced (e.g., targeting 15 men / 17 women)

• Flag issues immediately if numbers are off or approaching limits



This requires comfort with multi-variable tracking and checking numbers multiple times per day. I’m ideally looking for someone with a high "C" & high "S" in the DISC Assessment (please write out your DISC Assessment scores).



Conditional & Logic-Based Tasks

• Execute conditional logic workflows (if-then scenarios), such as:

• Sending different
s to men vs women based on ticket availability

• Triggering follow-ups based on survey responses

• Knowing which template to use based on status, timing, and inventory levels

• Ensure the correct message goes to the correct group at the correct time



Social Media (Execution Only- No Strategy Required)

• Post Instagram Stories from pre-made templates

• Schedule stories using Buffer

• Follow exact posting instructions (timing, captions, tagging)

• No content creation or creativity required — execution only



Community & Event Setup

• Create
 Events

• Post pre-scripted messages into
 groups

• Follow posting rules and instructions exactly



 & Review Follow-Ups

• Send follow-up
s to participants who complete post-event surveys

• Encourage Google Reviews using approved scripts

• Ensure
s are sent only to the correct segments



Tools You Must Be Comfortable Using

• ClickUp (task management required)

• Google Workspace

• Google Docs

• Google Sheets (must be comfortable with complex spreadsheets)

• Instagram (Stories posting + scheduling)

• Buffer (or willingness to learn quickly)

• ChatGPT (for problem-solving, clarification, and drafting)

• Zapier experience is a BIG plus (not required but highly preferred)



Schedule & Availability Requirements

• Remote

• U.S. work hours strongly preferred

• Must be able to check ticket levels morning and evening (U.S. time)

• Weekend availability required 1-3hrs in the morning & evening on saturday & sunday. Please let me know if this works for you in your reply.

- Monday–Friday, you may choose 4-5 days to work 5–7 hours per day. You may opt to work 6 days instead of 5 if you prefer shorter daily hours—I’m flexible- as long as you get time-sensitive tasks finished. Some tasks will be time sensitive, others are flexible.



Hours & Growth

• Start at 25–30 hours/week guaranteed, and then ramp into full-time

• Workload will grow as we:

• Add more cities

• Launch new projects

• Expand operations

• We intentionally do not overload you at the start so there’s room to grow



Who You Are (This Is Important)



You are someone who:

• Is extremely detail-oriented (double-checks everything)

• Enjoys systems, structure, and checklists

• Can follow SOPs without improvising

• Notices inconsistencies others miss

• Is fast and accurate

• Can work independently without constant reminders

• Enjoys improving systems after mastering them

• Is comfortable with repetitive but important work



This is not a good fit if you:

• Prefer creative work

• Dislike repetition

• “Skim” instructions

• Get bored easily with admin tasks



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)

• 13th-month pay

• Birthday bonus

• Unpaid holidays allowed with advance notice (approval required for coverage)



We strongly reward:

• Reliability

• Accuracy

• Initiative

• Trustworthiness



Our Promise



We are building a long-term team. If you do excellent work, grow with the systems, and help the company scale:

• You will grow with us

• Your pay will increase

• Your role will expand



We value people who do quiet, excellent work behind the scenes- and we take care of them.



WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER APPLICANTS THAT ANSWER THIS QUESTION IN THE SUBJECT LINE: What is your favorite food EVER?!



Looking forward to hearing from you and finding the perfect fit to join our team!



Best,



Mel

title: CRO Optimizer Specialist  (Shopify)

?

title: Video Editor needed for regular, ongoing work
description:
THE COMPANY

Avalon Creative Group is a dynamic and innovative company headquartered in the heart of the San Francisco Bay Area and Silicon Valley in California. We specialize in the creation of captivating and immersive content for corporate clients, offering comprehensive content design, production, and creative services. Working with Avalon Creative Group presents an exciting opportunity for individuals seeking to collaborate with renowned brands, while also offering a continuous learning environment that fosters personal and professional growth.



JOB DESCRIPTION

Avalon Creative Group is seeking a talented and experienced video editor and 3D animator based in the Philippines to work with us as an independent contractor. Our work includes videos to inspire audiences at corporate events, on-demand marketing webinars, internal corporate training and sales enablement, product demos, highlight reels, social media ads, interviews, customer testimonials and more. 



Our goal is to establish a long term working relationship with a creative, reliable and ambitious video professional. After successfully completing an initial trial period, the right person will become an integral member of our creative team on a full-time contract basis.



RESPONSIBILITIES

> Edit high quality videos from a variety of sources, including single-camera, multi-camera, stock footage, AI generated video, graphic elements, music, sound effects, etc.

> Effectively and efficiently generate video footage and elements using the latest AI tools

> Manage accuracy and correction of color and audio

> Understand and apply corporate branding and style guidelines and templates (MOGRTs)

> Manage, organize and backup video assets and deliverables, including raw footage, graphics, sound files, stock footage, projects, files, etc.

> Adhere to budgeted time constraints while incorporating client feedback and changes through multiple rounds of review and revisions

> Contribute to and consistently apply efficient workflow processes and standards (SOPs)

> Document guidelines and process details for tea
mbers and clients

> Pursue ongoing professional development and skill enhancements



REQUIRED SKILLS

> Having a proven track record of punctuality, reliability and professionalism is essential

> Excellent attention to detail and adeptness at managing multiple concurrent projects is required

> Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment

> English fluency (written and spoken) along with excellent communication skills are essential

> You must be based in the Philippines with fast, reliable internet access and a robust computer

> You must have a quiet workspace where you can work without distractions and join Zoom calls



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

> At least 2 years of professional experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Premiere Pro and After Effects

> Bonus if you have experience or proficiency with using 3D software like Blender, Cinema4D, or anything similar.

> You must have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work that demonstrates your passion and experience with video editing and motion graphics

>> Your portfolio must include examples of the type of work listed in the job description section

> Expertise in video editing fundamentals and techniques, including pacing, storytelling, and continuity

> Knowledge of different video formats and codecs for various delivery platforms



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

> 5 years of experience with Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects.

> At least 2 years of experience and proficiency with Blender or Cinema 4D.

> Proficiency in color correction, audio editing, and mastering

> Familiarity with team communication and project management tools like Smartsheet, Slack, ClickUp, or similar platforms

> Familiarity or experience using AI post-production tools

> Strong understanding of visual composition, typography, and graphic design principles

> Completion of training and/or certifications in key software used

> Knowledge of social media platforms and video encoding specifications for each platform



COMPENSATION & ENGAGEMENT

> Compensation rate for full-time, independent contractor will be $
USD per month

> Ten paid holidays and ten days of accrued paid time off (PTO) will be included annually

> Rate will be based on qualifications and experience

> This is a remote work position

> Work hours will need to overlap with standard business hours in California (9:00-6:00pm PT)



HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in working with us as an independent contractor and you meet the required qualifications listed above, please APPLY HERE -

title: Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert
description:
We are seeking an experienced Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert to manage, secure, and optimise our Google Workspace environment. This role requires a detail-oriented, proactive professional who can assess risks, implement security policies, and protect our organisation from credential leaks, malware threats, and unauthorised access.



You will own the security and administration lifecycle—monitoring accounts, enforcing password and MFA policies, responding to security i
, coordinating with teams on risk mitigation, and ensuring smooth communication regarding security practices. The ideal candidate will also provide guidance to tea
mbers, foster security awareness, and continuously look for ways to improve processes to safeguard both company and client data.





Who We Are:

121 Group is a full-service digital marketing agency that has successfully delivered campaigns for clients across a broad range of industries. We can provide branding, marketing, digital and communication services, specialising in healthcare, fashion, lifestyle & beauty, mining, construction, and renewables. Our data-driven approach to customer acquisition will grow your revenue and allow you to reach new audiences.





Job Summary: 

The Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert is responsible for ensuring the security, management, and compliance of all Google Workspace accounts. Responsibilities include monitoring account activity, enforcing password policies, managing multi-factor authentication, mitigating security risks, coordinating i
 response, and ensuring all tea
mbers follow best practices for digital security. You will work closely with leadership and IT to safeguard sensitive company and client information, guide the team in secure workflows, and proactively identify improvements in system security.





Responsibilities:

- Manage and administer Google Workspace accounts, groups, permissions, and shared resources.

- Enforce enterprise-level password policies, including forced resets and complexity standards.

- Implement and monitor Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all accounts.

- Monitor and respond to credential leaks, unauthorised logins, and suspicious activity.

- Conduct monthly security audits and stress-tests to identify vulnerabilities.

- Investigate malware and security threats on local devices and workstations.

- Guide staff in secure password management and transition to enterprise-grade password managers.

- Coordinate with leadership and IT teams to manage security i
 and ensure business continuity.

- Maintain logs, reports, and documentation of security protocols, i
, and resolutions.

- Proactively identify opportunities to improve system security and internal processes.

- Provide coaching and guidance to tea
mbers on cybersecurity best practices.





Requirements:

- Proven experience managing and securing Google Workspace environments.

- Strong knowledge of enterprise password policies, MFA, and credential management.

- Hands-on experience responding to security i
, malware detection, and credential leaks.

- Familiarity with cybersecurity tools, threat detection, and vulnerability management.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills for guiding staff and reporting to leadership.

- Exceptional organisational, problem-solving, and multitasking skills.

- Ability to manage multiple security priorities simultaneously and meet deadlines.

- Experience documenting processes, SOPs, and i
 reports.

- Flexible and proactive, willing to step in to resolve urgent security issues.

- High integrity and discretion in handling sensitive information.

- Capability to start immediately.

- Certifications are a plus: Google Workspace Administrator, Google Security Engineer, CompTIA Security+, CISSP, or other relevant IT security certifications.



Please send your updated resume and portfolio to

title: Amazon Account Manager
description:
REQUIREMENT To Be Considered For this Position -  Please send a Loom Video no greater than 5 minutes long introducing yourself and your background and why you are a good fit for this position. 



Job Description:

We are seeking a hands-on, detail-oriented Amazon Account Listings Manager to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for executing and optimizing all aspects of our Amazon presence—managing product listings, A+ content, advertising, and creative assets.



The ideal candidate must be skilled in both strategy and execution, with recent, direct experience managing Amazon accounts for DTC brands in the U.S. and Canadian markets. 



Key Responsibilities:



Create and optimize high-converting product listings (titles, bullets, images, A+ content, Brand Story, Brand Store management).



Variation creation is a MUST - candidates that are not highly capable in this aspect will not be considered.



Analyze Amazon reports to determine optimal bundle creations to drive AOV on Amazon



Design and edit listing visuals using Canva, Photoshop, or similar tools—hands-on creative execution preferred (but not required).



Build and update A+ Content pages and Amazon Storefronts to strengthen brand presence.



Launch, manage, and optimize Amazon PPC campaigns (Sponsored Products, Brands, Display).



Analyze key performance metrics (CTR, CVR, TACoS, sessions) and drive continuous improvements.



Conduct regular competitor research, keyword tracking, and market analysis.



Maintain full compliance with Amazon policies and proactively manage account health.



Monitor and respond to customer reviews, questions, and feedback to protect brand reputation.



Build and maintain database on Notion and establish SOPs and process controls tied to Amazon management and optimization



Qualifications:



5+ years of direct experience managing Amazon Seller Central or Vendor Central accounts.



Experienced with Notion to build and maintain product databases, KPI tracking, and any other required automations



Proven track record of personally creating and optimizing listings and developing A+ Content.



Proficient in using Canva and Photoshop for creating and editing listing assets.



Strong hands-on experience with Amazon Ads Manager and PPC campaign management - knowledge of Scale Insights is a MAJOR plus.



Data-driven mindset with strong analytical and reporting skills.



Excellent English communication skills—clear, concise, and brand-aligned.



Experience supporting DTC (direct-to-consumer) brands selling physical products in the U.S. market.



Required Skills:

Familiarity with tools like Notion, Helium 10, Jungle Scout, Data Dive, or similar.

Background in A/B testing and conversion rate optimization for Amazon listings.

Exposure to Shopify or other e-commerce platforms is a plus.

We clone trending web apps/SaaS and localize them for the Korean market (ko-KR), based on benchmark apps we provide.

This is not a typical employee role—we’re looking for a partner-like CTO who can ship fast and iterate with us long-term. Workflow wise and revenue wise

- Rebuild core features quickly (MVP first, then improve).



## Compensation (low upfront, high upside)

- High performance-based rewards after delivery (based on shipping speed, quality, and traction).

- We’ll align clearly in writing on time commitment, deliverables, and compensation structure (retainer/project + upside). 

- milestone-based bonuses and payment



## Requirements

- Shipped at least 1 real app/SaaS (live links required).

- Subscription payments + webhook handling experience.

- Must be comfortable building fast with AI tools

You don’t need every skill below—if you don’t know something, it’s fine. Just answer truthfully and please be specific.

title: Director of Capital Operations & Investor Coordination
description:
Director of Capital Operations & Investor Coordination

Company: Bottom Billion Corporation (BBC)

Location: India or Philippines (Remote)

Job Type: Full-time

Working Hours: Flexible, with significant overlap with US & Europe time zones

Compensation: Competitive regional salary + performance-based incentives



About Bottom Billion Corporation



Bottom Billion Corporation (BBC) is a global impact investment firm focused on building scalable platforms in agribusiness, affordable housing, circular economy initiatives, and green infrastructure across Africa, Asia, South America, and the United States.



BBC operates with a lean, execution-focused team and works closely with international investors, advisors, and on-the-ground operators to structure and finance real-asset projects in emerging and developed markets.



Role Overview



BBC is seeking a Director of Capital Operations & Investor Coordination to support its capital formation activities, investor communications, and financial execution efforts.



This is a hands-on, execution-heavy role ideal for someone comfortable with high-volume outreach, investor coordination, financial support work, and cross-time-zone communication. The role works closely with senior leadership and external advisors but does not carry final decision-making authority.



The position is well-suited for candidates based in India or the Philippines who are experienced in finance, capital markets support, or investor operations and are comfortable engaging professionally with global stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities



Investor Outreach & Coordination



Conduct outbound investor outreach via
, LinkedIn, and scheduled calls under guidance from senior leadership

Coordinate and schedule investor meetings across multiple time zones

Serve as a point of contact for follow-ups, information requests, and ongoing communications

Maintain CRM and investor tracking systems



Capital Operations & Execution Support



Support preparation of pitch decks, financial models, term-sheet summaries, and investor materials

Assist with data room preparation, document organization, and diligence requests

Coordinate with external advisors (legal, structuring, placement agents) as needed

Track progress across multiple capital-raising initiatives and platforms



Financial & Project Support



Assist with budgeting, forecasts, and project-level financial tracking

Support SPV-level documentation and capital structure coordination

Gather and consolidate inputs from on-the-ground project teams



Internal Coordination



Work closely with senior leadership, finance leadership, and regional operators

Ensure timely communication flow between investors, advisors, and internal teams

Prepare internal summaries and updates for leadership review



Authority & Reporting



This role does not have authority to make binding financial commitments

All investment decisions, term sheets, and capital commitments are approved by senior leadership

Reports directly to senior management / finance leadership



Qualifications



3–7 years of experience in finance, investment support, capital markets operations, consulting, or investor relations support

Strong written and verbal English communication skills (required)

Comfortable handling frequent calls, follow-ups, and outreach

Solid understanding of financial concepts, investment structures, or project finance (hands-on experience preferred)

Highly organized, responsive, and execution-oriented

Comfortable working across time zones and managing multiple workstreams

Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Google Workspace, and CRM tools

Experience working with international teams or investors is a strong plus



Compensation & Growth



Competitive full-time salary aligned with local market

Performance-based incentives tied to outreach effectiveness and execution milestones

Opportunity to grow into more senior capital operations or finance leadership roles as the company scales

Direct exposure to global investors, structured finance, and real-asset projects



Application Instructions

Please submit:

Resume

Brief note outlining relevant experience with investor outreach, finance support, or capital operations

Apply via
:

????

nts

nts”

- Enjoys analysing content and reverse-engineering why it works

** IN YOUR RESPONSE PLEASE INCLUDE EXAMPLES OF SHORT-FORM CONTENT YOU'VE CREATED AND WHAT YOU WOULD PERSONALLY DO TO HELP THIS BRAND GROW USING VIDEO **

title: Credit Repair Customer Service Representative
description:
PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH A CREDIT REPAIR COMPANY.



Position: Customer Service Representative (Credit Repair Experience Required)

Starting Pay: $600 USD



Thank you for your interest in joining our team at Credit Miracles!



We are currently seeking a reliable, experienced, and highly motivated Customer Service Representative to join our fast-paced credit repair team. This position is fully remote and requires a minimum of one year of customer service experience within a credit repair company. Candidates without this specific experience will not be considered.



This role is client-facing and critical to the success of our business. As a Customer Service Representative, you will serve as the first point of contact for our clients, helping them stay informed, supported, and confident throughout their credit repair journey. You will communicate via
, phone, chat, and social media and be expected to uphold our company’s five-star service standards at all times.



Minimum Requirements to Be Successful in This Role:

• At least 1 year of experience working in customer service within the credit repair industry (required)

• Reliable internet connection and quiet, professional work environment

• Strong knowledge of credit repair processes, dispute timelines, credit monitoring, and client expectations

• Experience using credit repair CRMs such as DisputeFox or Credit Repair Cloud

• Proficiency in Gmail, Google Docs, Zoom, and client management systems

• Must be self-motivated, dependable, and able to follow instructions without constant supervision

• Strong communication skills (spoken and written)

• Ability to handle multiple clients and cases while staying organized and meeting deadlines

• Must be comfortable handling difficult client situations with empathy and professionalism

• Ability to learn and adapt to evolving procedures and systems



Job Responsibilities:

• Deliver exceptional client support via phone,
, chat, and social media

• Monitor client accounts and credit reports using internal systems and credit monitoring platforms

• Respond promptly to client inquiries, billing questions, and credit concerns

• Provide accurate, clear, and friendly communication

• Log all interactions and updates within our CRM system in real-time

• Send and follow up on onboarding documents, payment issues, credit monitoring access, and more

• Educate clients about basic credit building tools, their responsibilities, and our process

• Flag and escalate complex cases to senior tea
mbers as needed

• Ensure clients remain engaged, compliant, and supported throughout their program

• Follow company policies, maintain client confidentiality, and remain TSR and FCRA compliant



Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required):

• Experience in billing or payment resolution

• Experience in Canva to create marketing flyers

• Familiarity with dispute flows and credit education

• Bilingual in Spanish and English



This is a remote position, and the schedule may change at any given time due to business needs. Also reliability and responsiveness during work hours are essential.



If you are passionate about helping others, have real experience in credit repair, and are ready to grow with a high-performing team, we’d love to hear from you.



Apply now and help us change lives through credit restoration

title: Full time Long Form Content Editor
description:
I am looking for a long-form video editor who can create content at a level similar to this example:





About the role:

You will be responsible for editing long-form YouTube-style videos from start to finish. This includes sourcing all B-roll and supporting clips yourself, which is the most time-consuming part of the process. You will also generate the voice-over (I will provide access to the tool).



Initially, the content will be in Polish, so you will need to translate the script, fully understand the meaning, and adapt visuals accordingly. It’s very doable, but attention to detail is important.



Workload:

Around 10 videos per month

Average length: ~20 minutes per video



From my experience speaking with editors, it usually takes around 30–60 minutes to edit one minute of finished video. On average, we estimate about 45 minutes of editing time per finished minute.



20 minutes of finished video × 45 minutes of editing time per minute = ~900 minutes of work per video



Pay:



* $2.50 per finished minute

* This equals roughly $3.50/hour based on the estimated editing time

* While the hourly rate may seem low, the workload is consistent and high-volume, which adds up to a solid monthly paycheck



Requirements:

- Very good English (spoken and written)

- Ability to understand content, translate it into Polish, and match visuals to the meaning

- Strong skills in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects

- Ability to source high-quality B-roll and clips independently

- Comfortable generating voice-overs using provided tools

- Available for daily calls/check-ins

- Able to work full-time and commit long-term



Who I’m looking for:

Someone reliable, detail-oriented, and willing to grow with a long-term project. If you’re consistent and can maintain quality at scale, this can become a stable full-time position with ongoing work every month.

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
*** Pay is negotiable, I am seeking an EXPERT, and I will pay whatever it takes! Please don’t apply if you are not an expert construction project manager. The more experience and the more dedication, the higher the pay. A background in engineering is preferred but not required, you must however be an EXPERT at reading construction plans and conducting quantity estimates and takeoffs.  I have listed pay at $800, the pay range is from $
.  At the absolute maximum of $1200 you must have been doing this for at least ten years, speak english at a native level, and be extremely experienced in all of the responsibilities listed below.***



This position will be for an expert at the clerical construction management responsibilities, to include all submittal logs, RFP/RFQ logs, calling vendors, ordering, creating documents, word processing, scheduling, managing Primavera, Oracle, and Procore.  You must be experienced in all aspects and you must be extremely diligent in your work, mistakes cannot be made.  You must be organized and persistent, this position is only for the right person that is experienced and understands this type of work as it relates to successfully managing a commercial construction project. 



You must speak excellent english and be comfortable making phone calls, managing a contacts list, seeking out new vendors using search engines and other services, and managing relationships with vendors. You must be extremely organized and be able to work independently to manage projects and work on the different aspects of administration, purchasing, and management from bidding to completion. 



Our firm is looking for a construction project manager with a preferred engineering or architecture background, preferably with experience working for USA based firms. Having experience working for a government or public works contractor is a huge plus in the USA. Our firm is based in New Jersey, USA. We are a general contractor specializing in government contracts, specialty work and engineering. We are interested in hiring a project manager to assist with a variety of critical tasks in a full time capacity. You should be willing to do general administration tasks in addition to the day to day work required as an engineering project manager and estimator. Position requires 40 - 50 hours per week to start. Basic hours will be 9-5 but earlier starts May be needed on bid days. Extra hours may be required as needed possibly over the weekends to prepare for the next work week. Schedule should be flexible. If you are performing well there is room for growth.



-Must speak excellent English

-Must be EXCELLENT at technical reading and writing in English

-Must be able to read all blue prints in detail and understand them at EXPERT level

-Must be comfortable interpreting specifications 

-Takeoffs must be precise and must be able to get down to actual material quantities (not mandatory)

-Must be patient, quick thinking, organized, good working under pressure, good managing tasks and deadlines

-Staying organized and filing everything, managing google drive and
s

Notes: iPhone preferred, text message communication proficiency a plus. If you don’t have an iPhone experience with one helps. Must be good on the phone. True full time required on American hours. Must answer phone calls and
 messages after screening or creating reports of calls. Using online fax service to send faxes. We use MAC, you can use PC as needed but be able to work with MAC compatibility as needed.

title: Business Development Manager - EdTech Sales
description:
Summary

We're building our sales function from scratch. You'll hire and train AEs, build our playbook, develop strategy, make calls, and close deals.



Critical: We care about results, not activity. Smart prospecting and quality conversations matter far more than mindless dialing. We're building a team focused on outcomes—qualified opportunities, demos, and signed contracts.



What You'll Own



Sales Team Development

- Hire, train, and manage 2-3 full-cycle Account Executives

- Create onboarding programs and coaching systems

- Conduct weekly pipeline reviews and regular 1-on-1s



Sales Infrastructure

- Build sales playbook: qualification, discovery, demo, objection handling, closing

- Implement and optimize HubSpot CRM - pipelines, automation, sequences, reporting

- Develop smart prospecting strategies and ideal customer profiles

- Design metrics focused on outcomes (revenue, conversions) not just activity (dials,
s)



Market & Strategy

- Identify target segments (K-12 vs higher ed, public vs private)

- Focus on K-12 online schools initially

- Develop account-based strategies for high-value prospects

- Analyze win/loss data to refine approach



Direct Sales

- Close deals personally, especially complex opportunities

- Handle escalations and negotiations

- Model best practices



The EdTech Reality - Read Carefully



Sales cycles: 12-18 months. A hot prospect in March might go dark until August. Budget approvals take 6+ months. You'll manage 40+ opportunities simultaneously. Deals you start in Q1 2026 might close in Q3 2027.



Key challenges: Seasonal buying patterns (summer dead, Q2/Q4 busy). Multiple stakeholders (teachers, admins, IT, procurement—one "no" kills deals). Budget constraints (restricted/grant-funded). Risk aversion (schools want proof, references, pilots).



Your success depends on: Building resilient AEs who understand long cycles, creating 6-18 month nurture sequences, understanding education procurement, qualifying ruthlessly, building pipeline 3-4x quota, leveraging HubSpot automation for consistent touchpoints.



This isn't transactional SaaS. If you need quick wins, this isn't the right role.



Success Timeline



Months 1-2: 50-70 dials/day learning product/market. Close 1-2 deals, hire first AE, build playbook, set up HubSpot.



Months 3-6: 30-40 dials/day as player-coach. Team of 1-2 AEs ramping. 50% selling, 50% coaching.



Months 6-12: 20-30 dials/day. Team of 3 AEs hitting 6-9 deals/month total. Focus on coaching, strategy, complex deals.



Compensation



- Base: $1,200-1,600/month USD

- Commission: 8% on personal deals + 2% team override - average deal size is ~$10,000

- Team bonus when hitting targets



Requirements



Must Have:

- Focused on making money, be "coin operated"

- 3+ years B2B sales, 1+ year sales leadership

- Track record closing $5K-50K deals

- Strong prospecting skills—quality over quantity

- Results-driven mindset—success measured by revenue, not activity metrics

- Proven ability managing 6+ month sales cycles

- Hands-on HubSpot CRM experience—building pipelines, sequences, automation, reports

- Exceptional English (native/near-native fluency required) - daily calls with US school administrators who must easily understand you. Clear, professional pronunciation essential.

- Self-directed and entrepreneurial

- Patience for 12-18 month cycles



Strongly Preferred:

- Experience selling to schools/universities

- Understanding of education procurement

- EdTech, SaaS, or subscription sales background

- HubSpot Sales Hub Professional/Enterprise experience



What matters: We track activity but evaluate on outcomes. "I made 70 dials but got no conversations" is a problem to solve, not success. Smart targeting beats brute force. Your success = team's success.



Interview includes: live video call with mock pitch, role-play with objections, demonstrating clear explanations to non-technical audiences.



To Apply



Submit:

1. Resume/CV

2. Brief explanation (200-300 words) of a sales process/playbook you've built—situation, what you created, results

3. Answer: "What's the biggest mistake sales teams make selling to schools with long buying cycles? How would you avoid it?"

4. 2-3 minute video introduction explaining why you're interested and your relevant experience

5. Describe your HubSpot experience with specific examples



Why This Role Matters



You'll build the foundation of our sales organization. The processes you create, people you hire, and culture you establish will shape our growth for years. If you want impact, and the chance to build something from scratch in a challenging but rewarding market, this is it.



The right person understands that slow and steady wins in education sales. You'll be building a machine designed for the long game, not quick hits.



Deliverables:

Build and manage sales team

Develop sales processes

Manage long sales cycles

Lead strategic sales initiatives

Optimize HubSpot CRM

title: IT Tech Support - AWS EC2 expert/moderat
description:
Job Description:



We are a growing IT consulting firm, managed service provider, or small business seeking a dedicated and skilled Remote IT Support Specialist to join our team as a full-time employee. You will provide exceptional technical support to our clients, resolving IT issues quickly and efficiently using our osTicket help desk system. This is a remote position based in the Philippines, working US Eastern Time (8 AM - 5 PM EDT/EST), which is 8 PM - 5 AM Philippine Time (PHT). We require excellent English communication skills, deep technical expertise, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.



Key Responsibilities:



Remote Support: Use tools like Ultraviewer, TeamViewer, AnyDesk, or Microsoft Remote Desktop to connect remotely and resolve client IT issues promptly.  Please reply with the remote support tools you use and are comfortable with.  



Help Desk Management: Log, track, and resolve client issues using osTicket, ensuring clear documentation and timely follow-ups.  



Windows & Server Management: Troubleshoot and fix issues on Windows 7, 10, 11 and Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, 2022, 2025.  



Virtualization: Configure and manage Hyper-V environments, including virtual machine setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting.  



AWS EC2 knowledge - ***Extremely important*** - create new servers, delete servers, remove old backups, schedule backs -  make current infrastructure cost efficient, backup, restore.



Networking: Administer Domain Controllers, DNS, and troubleshoot network connectivity issues.  



VoIP Systems: Manage and troubleshoot Asterisk PBX/FreePBX for client telephony systems.  



Cloud & Security: Whitelist IP addresses in AWS security groups and ensure secure configurations.  



VPN Support: Set up and troubleshoot VPN clients (e.g., Microsoft VPN, OpenVPN) for secure client access.  



 Management: Configure and troubleshoot Microsoft 365, Exchange 2010/2019, Outlook, and Gmail for clients.  



 Security: Manage Vipre Mail Security, including whitelisting/blacklisting
 addresses and releasing quarantined messages.  



SEO Tasks: Perform basic SEO tasks (e.g., keyword optimization, content updates) to support client websites.  

Responsiveness: Prioritize urgent client issues and provide timely resolutions during work hours, with occasional availability for critical after-hours support (with notice).



Must-Have Qualifications:Technical Skills:  2-3+ years of experience in IT support, with expertise in Windows 7, 10, 11 and Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, 2022, 2025.  

Strong knowledge of Hyper-V for virtualization management.  

Proficiency in Domain Controllers, DNS, and network troubleshooting.  

Experience with Asterisk PBX/FreePBX for VoIP systems.  

Familiarity with AWS (specifically whitelisting IPs in security groups).  

Expertise in VPN clients (Microsoft VPN, OpenVPN) setup and troubleshooting.  

In-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365, Exchange 2010/2019, Outlook, and Gmail setup/troubleshooting.  

Experience with Vipre Mail Security for
 whitelisting/blacklisting and quarantine management.  

Basic SEO skills (e.g., on-page optimization, keyword research).



Help Desk: Experience with osTicket or similar ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk) for issue tracking and documentation.  



Remote Tools: Proficient with remote support tools like TeamViewer, AnyDesk, or Microsoft Remote Desktop.  

Communication: Fluent English (spoken and written) for professional client interactions via
, chat, or video calls.  

Availability: Able to work 8 AM - 5 PM EDT/EST (8 PM - 5 AM PHT) with a stable internet connection (minimum 10 Mbps) and a quiet, professional workspace.  



Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving, attention to detail, and ability to handle multiple client issues under pressure.



Nice-to-Have Skills:Familiarity with Linux servers for hybrid environments.  

Knowledge of firewall configurations (e.g., SonicWall, Fortinet) for network security.  

Basic scripting skills (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) for task automation.  

Prior experience in a client-facing IT support role.



Work Details:Employment Type: Full-time, direct hire (you’ll be our employee, not a freelancer).  

Schedule: 40 hours/week, 8 AM - 5 PM US Eastern Time (EDT/EST), equivalent to 8 PM - 5 AM Philippine Time.  

Location: Fully remote from the Philippines with a reliable computer and high-speed internet.

.  

Payment Method: Via PayPal





How to Apply:

Submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining your experience with osTicket, Hyper-V, Asterisk PBX, AWS, and Vipre Mail Security.  



Include links to any relevant certifications (e.g., Microsoft, AWS, CompTIA) or a portfolio of past IT projects.  

Be prepared to complete a short trial task (e.g., resolving a sample network issue or configuring an
 account in osTicket) during the hiring process.  



Participate in a video interview to assess your English fluency and technical expertise.



Why Join Us?

Work with a supportive team and diverse clients.  

Gain experience with modern IT tools and systems, including osTicket, AWS, and Microsoft 365.  

Stable, long-term role with potential for growth and additional responsibilities.

title: Telemarketing Manager (Player–Coach Role)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a Telemarketing Manager who leads from the front.



This is not a sit-back management role.

You will dial every day, transfer prospects to licensed agents, train the team, and own results.



If you believe the best leaders set the example, coach daily, and hold people accountable — this role is for you.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Leadership & Management

• Hire, train, and onboard new telemarketers

• Coach the team daily through call reviews, feedback, and role-playing

• Hold telemarketers accountable to daily and weekly KPIs

• Make hiring and firing decisions based on performance

• Build a motivated, disciplined, high-output team

• Track attendance, productivity, and results

• Strong leadership and people management skills

• Ability to work under pressure and ensure targets are consistently met



Hands-On Telemarketing (Non-Negotiable)

• Dial daily and transfer auto and home insurance leads

• Hit your own personal performance goals

• Lead by example — your numbers matter

• Demonstrate best practices on live calls



Performance Ownership

• Responsible for team results AND your own results

• Improve scripts, rebuttals, and call flow specific to auto & home insurance

• Identify underperformance early and correct it fast

• Report daily and weekly performance metrics



Required Experience (Must Have)

• Minimum of 1 years telemarketing experience in Auto and Home insurance

• Proven success dialing outbound leads and cold prospects

• Minimum 6 months Prior experience managing or leading a telemarketing team

• Strong English communication skills (clear, confident speaking)

• Comfortable coaching, correcting, and holding people accountable

• Reliable internet, quality headset, and quiet workspace

• Availability during U.S. Pacific Time business hours



Key Traits We Value

• Ownership mentality — excuses don’t fly here

• Competitive but supportive leader

• Numbers-driven and disciplined

• Thinks long-term and wants to grow with a company

• Comfortable being measured by results



Compensation & Growth

• Competitive base pay (based on experience)

• Performance bonuses tied to team production and personal output

• Long-term role with advancement opportunities

• Stable work environment with clear expectations



Why This Role Is Different



You won’t be babysitting.

You won’t be guessing expectations.

You won’t be managing people who don’t dial.



This role is about building a winning telemarketing team, producing results, and taking pride in performance.



How to Apply



Please answer the following with your application:

1. How many years of auto and home insurance telemarketing experience do you have?

2. How many telemarketers have you managed before?

3. What KPIs do you believe matter most for an insurance telemarketing team?

4. Are you comfortable dialing daily while managing others? (Yes/No)

5. How do you handle underperforming tea
mbers?



We are hiring for experience, leadership, and performance — not potential.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Crypto/Fintech Platform
description:
We are building an institutional-grade crypto & market intelligence platform combining:

• CIO-style investment research & alerts

• Portfolio intelligence & monitoring

• Modular SaaS subscriptions (Free, Essential, Pro, Elite AI)

We are transitioning from founder-written BRDs to developer-executable specifications and are looking for a strong Business Analyst to bridge this gap.

Our current BRDs clearly describe what we want to build, but not always how developers should build it.

Your mission is to:

• Convert strategy, product vision, and CIO logic into

• Clear, unambiguous, build-ready requirements that engineers can execute without guesswork

You will work closely with:

• Founder / Product Owner, Head of Technology, Frontend & Backend Developers



Key Responsibilities

1. BRD ? Developer-Ready Translation

• Decompose high-level BRDs into:

o Functional Requirements (FRs)

o Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs)

o Edge cases & constraints

• Remove ambiguity and assumptions from requirements

2. Functional Specifications & User Stories

• Write clear user stories with:

o Actors

o Preconditions

o Main flows

o Alternate / exception flows

• Define acceptance criteria that are testable

3. Data & Logic Definition

• Specify:

o Data inputs (APIs, internal DB, calculations)

o Output formats (tables, charts, alerts)

o Refresh frequency & timing logic

• Define portfolio logic:

o Price snapshots

o PnL calculations

o Options & derivatives handling

o Risk flags & disclosures

4. UI / UX Logic Support (Not Design)

• Clarify what the UI must do, not how it looks:

o Filters

o Sorting

o State changes

o Empty / error states

• Work with UI developers to ensure functional completeness

5. Alignment & Clarification

• Act as the single source of truth for requirements

• Answer developer questions and close gaps quickly

• Prevent rework caused by unclear specs

Required Experience & Skills (Non-Negotiable)

Core Experience

• 5+ years as a Business Analyst in:

o Fintech

o Trading platforms

o Wealth management systems

o Market data or analytics platforms

• Proven experience producing developer-ready specs, not just high-level BRDs

Domain Knowledge (Must Have)

• Financial instruments:

o Equities, ETFs

o Crypto assets

o Options / derivatives (basic to intermediate)

• Understanding of:

o Market prices

o PnL logic

o Risk & disclosures

o Portfolio tracking concepts

Technical Literacy (You don’t code, but…)

• Comfortable working with:

o APIs & data feeds

o Databases (tables, fields, relationships)

o Basic system flows & architectures

• Able to speak fluently with engineers

Documentation Quality

• Writes:

o Structured

o Precise

o Unambiguous

• Knows the difference between:

o “Business intent”

o “Functional requirement”

o “Acceptance criteria”

Nice to Have (Strong Plus)

• Experience with:

o SaaS subscription models

o Role-based access / paywalls

o Financial dashboards

• Prior work with:

o Startups or founder-led teams

o Incomplete or evolving requirements

• Familiarity with Agile / sprint-based delivery

Deliverables You Will Own

• Functional Specification Documents (FSDs)

• User stories with acceptance criteria

• Data logic & calculation notes

• Clarified, version-controlled requirements per module

This is a senior BA role focused on execution clarity.

title: Head of Finance & Accounting
description:
The Head of Finance will be responsible for financial strategy, unit economics, and operational finance across the business. You will work directly with the CEO to drive profitability, pricing decisions, inventory planning, and long-term financial health.



This role blends strategic finance + hands-on execution and is ideal for someone who understands how real consumer brands scale.



Core Responsibilities



Financial Strategy & Leadership

 • Act as the primary financial partner to the CEO

 • Build and maintain rolling forecasts (monthly, quarterly, annual)

 • Develop financial models for new SKUs, pricing changes, and channel expansion

 • Translate financial data into clear, actionable insights



Accounting, Systems & Controls

 • Own and oversee QuickBooks as the system of record

 • Ensure financials are accurate, timely, and compliant with U.S. GAAP

 • Oversee monthly close, reconciliations, and reporting

 • Manage external bookkeepers, CPAs, and tax partners

 • Strengthen internal controls and financial processes as the company scales



Unit Economics & Pricing Architecture

 • Own unit economics by SKU and channel (Amazon, DTC, wholesale)

 • Build and maintain contribution margin models (COGS, shipping, fees, marketing)

 • Design and evaluate pricing architecture, including:

 • MSRP vs DTC pricing

 • Amazon pricing and fees

 • Wholesale and retail margin structures

 • Support pricing decisions that balance growth, margins, and competitiveness



Cash Flow & Profitability

 • Own cash flow forecasting and working capital planning

 • Manage inventory-related cash constraints and reorder timing

 • Identify margin expansion and cost optimization opportunities

 • Ensure marketing spend aligns with profitability targets



Inventory & COGS Management

 • Build inventory forecasting models tied to demand, lead times, and seasonality

 • Track fully landed COGS (manufacturing, freight, duties, warehousing, prep)

 • Partner with Operations to avoid stockouts and excess inventory

 • Improve inventory visibility and reporting



Marketing & Channel Finance

 • Analyze CAC, blended LTV, MER, and payback periods

 • Support marketing budget decisions with financial modeling

 • Connect ad spend, inventory planning, and cash requirements



Capital & Long-Term Planning

 • Support decisions around credit facilities, debt, or future fundraising

 • Prepare financial materials for lenders, investors, or advisors

 • Help structure the business for long-term value creation and optional exit



What We’re Looking For



Must-Haves

 • 7+ years in finance, FP&A, or senior finance roles

 • Strong experience with consumer brands, ideally CPG or e-commerce

 • Hands-on experience with QuickBooks

 • Solid understanding of U.S. GAAP / U.S. accounting standards

 • Deep experience with unit economics and pricing strategy

 • Strong financial modeling skills (Excel / Google Sheets)

 • Comfortable working directly with a founder/CEO

 • Clear communicator who can simplify complex financial topics



Nice-to-Haves

 • Experience with Amazon FBA and DTC financials

 • Experience supporting retail or wholesale expansion

 • Background in supplements, food, or regulated consumer products

 • Experience scaling a business from $3M–$20M+ in revenue



What This Role Is Not

 • Not a bookkeeping-only role

 • Not a passive reporting position

 • Not a junior analyst role



This is a senior, high-impact role with real ownership and influence.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
About the Role



We are a Canadian print and design company looking for a full-time Graphic Designer with strong experience in print production and scalable mockup creation. This role is ideal for someone who understands how designs move from concept to print and can efficiently produce reusable mockups for high-volume and repeat projects.



Responsibilities

 • Prepare print-ready artwork for marketing materials, signage, packaging, and branded assets

 • Create and maintain scalable mockups (templates that can be quickly adapted across sizes, locations, and variations)

 • Set up files correctly for print production (bleed, trim, margins, CMYK, resolution, export settings)

 • Adapt and resize designs and mockups for multiple formats and specifications

 • Follow brand guidelines and ensure consistency across repeat jobs

 • Handle high-volume, production-driven work with strong attention to detail

 • Manage revisions, approvals, and production tasks using Notion

 • Communicate clearly to ensure accuracy before files are released for print



Requirements

 • 5+ years of experience in graphic or multimedia design

 • Strong proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop (InDesign a plus)

 • Solid understanding of print production fundamentals

 • Proven ability to create reusable, scalable mockups (not one-off designs)

 • Experience working with structured brand systems

 • Comfortable in deadline-driven, production-heavy workflows

 • High attention to detail and quality control

 • Clear written communication and reliability

 • Ability to work EST hours (10:00 AM – 6:00 PM)



Nice to Have

 • Large-format print or signage experience

 • Packaging or promotional product mockups

 • Light digital or social design support

 • Experience working with international clients



What We Offer

 • Stable, full-time remote role

 • Clear instructions and structured workflows

 • Long-term opportunity with a growing print company

 • Professional, respectful working environment



How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A short introduction

 2. A link to your portfolio (mockups and print work preferred)

 3. Your expected monthly salary

 4. Confirmation of availability for EST hours

title: Credit Repair - Billing /Enrollment
description:
JOB TITLE: Credit Repair Sales & Billing Specialist



LOCATION: Remote (Philippines)

EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Part-Time

HOURS: 25 hours per week

SCHEDULE: Either 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM OR 2:00 PM - 6:00 PM Central Standard Time, Monday-Friday (No weekends, No US holidays)

PAY RATE: $4.00 per hour



---



ABOUT US:

We are a boutique credit repair company with 15 years of experience helping professionals improve their credit profiles. We are scaling our operations and need a dedicated sales and billing specialist to assist with client enrollment, billing management, and
 support.



---



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



Enrollment & Sales:

- Make outbound calls to leads who have booked appointments to discuss our program

- Explain our services, pricing, and program details to prospective clients

- Help clients select the right service level and complete the enrollment process

- Follow up with existing clients to ensure they provide verification documents needed to complete enrollment

- Ensure billing is properly set up and initial payments are collected

- Answer questions about the program via outbound calls to leads



 Management:

- Categorize incoming
s into the correct folders/categories

- Respond to client inquiries via

- Send
 credit analysis reports to clients

- Maintain organized
 communication



Billing Support:

- Update invoices including adding and removing fees

- Ensure payments are collected on time

- Forward unpaid accounts to collections when necessary

- Process account cancellations

- Respond to billing inquiries from clients



IMPORTANT NOTE: The majority of this work involves OUTBOUND calls. We do not handle high volumes of inbound calls.



---

REQUIREMENTS:



Experience:

- Minimum 2 years of work-from-home customer service experience in a related role

- Credit repair experience is preferred but not required

- Experience with billing, sales, or enrollment is a plus



Technical Requirements (NON-NEGOTIABLE):

- MUST work on camera throughout entire shift (required)

- MUST share screen while working during all scheduled hours (required)

- These requirements exist because you will be handling sensitive client data and information

- Reliable high-speed internet connection (minimum 10 Mbps download, 5 Mbps upload)

- Working webcam with clear video quality

- Headset or working microphone

- Quiet, private workspace where client information cannot be overheard



Skills:

- Strong English communication skills (accent-neutral preferred)

- Customer service mindset

- Professional, reliable, and detail-oriented

- Comfortable with outbound calling

---

TRAINING SCHEDULE:



Week 1 Training (Monday - Thursday ONLY):

- Schedule: 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM Central Standard Time

- Includes 1 hour lunch break (11:00 AM - 12:00 PM)

- Hands-on, paid training provided

- Must pass final assessment to continue to regular work schedule



After Training:

- Regular shift begins (either 10 AM-2 PM OR 2 PM-6 PM CST)

- Monday - Friday

- No weekends, No US holidays

---

WHY WORK WITH US?



- Competitive pay at $4.00 per hour

- Part-time role with predictable hours

- Limited inbound call pressure (mostly outbound work)

- Independent work environment

- Opportunity to grow within the company

- Join a stable, reliable company with 15 years in business

- Hands-on paid training provided

- Monday-Friday schedule (No weekends, No US holidays)

- Professional, supportive work environment



---



TO BE CONSIDERED, YOU MUST SUBMIT:



1. A short video OR voice note (1-3 minutes) that includes:

   - Introduction of yourself

   - Description of your relevant experience for this role

   - Where you live and your age

   - Why you left your previous role (if not currently employed) OR details about your current role including job duties and schedule (if currently employed)



2. Updated resume



3. Reference information



IMPORTANT NOTES:



Camera & Screen Sharing Policy:

Working on camera and sharing your screen during all scheduled work hours is NON-NEGOTIABLE. This requirement exists to protect sensitive client data and ensure security compliance. If you cannot meet this requirement, please do not apply.



You may turn off your camera and stop screen sharing during scheduled breaks and lunch periods only.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Logistics Support Representative
description:
Job Title: Logistics Support Representative



Company: Goodcargo

Position location: Remote

Employment Type: Full
 Time (trial)



***About Us***

We are a growing Third-Party Logistics (3PL) provider dedicated to connecting shippers and carriers with dependable, efficient freight solutions. Our mission is to deliver exceptional service through transparency, communication, and reliability. We’re a fast-moving, team-oriented company where every employee plays a key role in our success.



***Position Overview***

We are seeking a Logistics Support Representative to join our operations team. This person will assist in the daily execution of freight operations, including booking loads, tracking and tracing shipments, and sourcing qualified carriers. The ideal candidate has experience working in a 3PL environment and understands the importance of communication, attention to detail, and customer service in freight coordination.



***Key Responsibilities***

Book and manage shipments through our Transportation Management System (TMS).

Source, vet, and negotiate with carriers using load boards and industry platforms (e.g., DAT, Truckstop, etc.).

Track and trace shipments from pick-up to delivery, ensuring on-time performance.

Communicate effectively with carriers, drivers, and customers regarding shipment status and updates.

Maintain accurate records of shipments, rate confirmations, and load details within the TMS.

Assist with issue resolution related to delays, damages, or accessorials.

Provide operational support to the logistics and carrier sales teams.

Support with Lead generation and new customer searches.



***Qualifications***

Required: Experience using a Transportation Management System (TMS).

Required: Proficiency with load boards (DAT, Truckstop, etc.).

Minimum 1–2 years of experience in a 3PL or freight brokerage environment.

Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.

Detail-oriented and proactive in problem-solving.

Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or Google Workspace tools.



***Why Join Us***

Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives.

Career growth opportunities within a dynamic 3PL company.

Supportive, team-driven culture with a focus on professional development.



***How to Apply***

If you’re a motivated logistics professional looking to grow in a fast-paced 3PL environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Please send your resume and a brief cover letter to 
 address] with the subject line: Logistics Support Representative – [Your Name]. Please also answer the following vetting questions





How many years of experience do you have working in a 3PL, freight brokerage, or logistics environment?

What Transportation Management System (TMS) platforms have you used in your previous roles?

Which load boards are you most familiar with (e.g., DAT, Truckstop, 123LoadBoard)?

Walk me through your process for booking a load from start to finish.

How do you track and trace shipments? What tools or methods do you rely on most?

When sourcing carriers, what factors do you consider to ensure reliability and compliance?

Tell me about a time when a shipment was delayed or went off schedule. How did you handle it?



What do you enjoy most about working in logistics and the 3PL industry?

title: WordPress Website Developer / UX-UI / Conversion Rate Optimization
description:
We are seeking a full-time WordPress Front-End Developer with strong UX and Conversion Rate Optimization experience to join our team in a permanent, full-time role.



This role involves designing and maintaining WordPress websites and webpages built using the Beaver Builder platform. 



It is not a ground-up website development position. The role is focused on ongoing optimization, support, and improvement of existing client websites, with an emphasis on landing pages, content updates, UX refinement, and conversion performance.



Time & Availability Requirements



- Full-time, 40 hours per week

- At least 50 percent of working hours must overlap with US Eastern Time (9 AM–5 PM EST)

- Remaining hours may be flexibly scheduled

- Strong written English is required for daily communication, documentation, and collaboration

- This role does not require client presentations or live client meetings.



What Success Looks Like



- Success in this role means reliably owning front-end website optimization and CRO execution across multiple active client sites.

- You will be responsible for identifying UX and conversion issues, implementing improvements, supporting seasonal and campaign-based updates, and producing clear, actionable CRO and UX recommendations for internal teams.

- The ideal candidate works independently, prioritizes high-impact work without constant oversight, communicates clearly in written English, and consistently follows through.



Core Responsibilities



- Populate and update content on existing websites (Always WordPress, mostly using Beaver Builder)

- Support seasonal updates, promotions, and campaign-based content changes

- Assist with wireframing, building and optimizing landing pages within existing WordPress websites

- Own conversion rate optimization initiatives from analysis through execution and internal reporting

- Implement UX improvements and content updates on live sites

- Analyze user behavior, funnels, and performance data to identify friction and opportunity

- Translate findings into clear CRO and UX recommendations for internal teams

- Collaborate with SEO and AI Optimization teams to align site performance goals

- Write and test conversion-focused copy informed by behavioral principles

- Configure and maintain analytics and testing tools during client onboarding

- Produce concise performance summaries and optimization insights

- Follow accessibility best practices, including WCAG 2.2 standards





Required Skills & Experience

- Demonstrated experience in UX, CRO, or conversion-focused web work

- Strong understanding of digital marketing fundamentals and user behavior

- WordPress experience mandatory

- Experience with Beaver Builder helpful (most of our sites are supported with this builder)

- Working knowledge of HTML and CSS

- Experience using Google Analytics or similar tools for insight generation

- Ability to work independently and solve problems without step-by-step instruction

- Impressive written English

- Strong organization, prioritization, and follow-through



Helpful but not required



- Experience using AI tools as a productivity multiplier

- Familiarity with ChatGPT, Gemini, or similar tools

- Experience with Figma or Looker Studio

- Basic JavaScript or PHP familiarity

Conversational level english-speaking ability REQUIRED.

10-15 hrs / week on average to start.

title: Medical Sales Specialist - Commission Based (Trial to Full-Time)
description:
We are looking for hungry, results driven salespeople with medical/healthcare sales experience who can find and close US healthcare clients. This is a performance-based opportunity meaning if you can sell, you'll earn well and secure a full time position.

Your role:

Find small to medium-sized US medical practices (solo doctors, group practices, clinics) who need these 2 roles filling for their company, full-time remote Medical Administrative Assistants or remote Medical Billing Specialists.



Compensation Structure:

Trial Period (2 weeks) - 100% commission-based. Earn $300 for every client who signs and onboards. 



After Trial (if you perform) - Full-time position with base salary + commission, you keep earning from clients secured every month.



What You Need to Do:

Prospecting - Find decision-makers (practice managers, doctors, office administrators) at US medical practices. Outreach - Cold
, LinkedIn, phone calls,
 groups - whatever works. Qualify leads - Ensure they actually need medical VAs and have budget. Present solution - Explain our services and our pricing for each virtual assistant and value proposition. Close deals - Get signed agreements and onboarded clients.

Target Metrics (2-week trial):

Minimum 50 qualified outreach contacts per week. Close 1-2 paying clients at the end of the 2 weeks to move to full-time.



Ideal Candidate:

MUST HAVE: Medical or healthcare sales experience (selling to clinics, practices, hospitals, or healthcare decision-makers). Comfortable with US business hours communication. Self-starter who doesn't need hand-holding. Fluent English (written and spoken). Has own laptop and reliable internet.

You'll Receive:

Company website and information. You must be able to create good scripts and hooks. 



How to Prove Yourself:

We're hiring multiple people for this 2-week trial. Whoever brings in real, paying clients gets the full-time role. Simple as that.

To Apply:

Send us: Your medical/healthcare sales experience and results. How you plan to find clients in your first week. Why you'll outperform the other candidates.

This is not for everyone. But if you're confident in your sales ability and want to build a client book that pays you monthly, let's talk.

title: Remote Customs Compliance Specialist (USMCA / CUSMA Focus – Post-Entry Corrections)
description:
We are a Canadian-based company shipping industrial and utility products into the United States. We are looking for a remote Customs Compliance Specialist to support U.S. import compliance, with an immediate focus on post-entry corrections and duty recovery under USMCA/CUSMA.



This is an execution role. You will not be filing entries directly with U.S. Customs, but you will be responsible for preparing accurate, defensible documentation that is submitted through our licensed customs broker.



Key Responsibilities



Review historical U.S. shipments that have already cleared customs



Identify duty overpayments related to incorrect HS classification or origin



Validate USMCA/CUSMA eligibility for U.S., Canadian, and Mexican origin goods



Prepare corrected documentation packages (commercial invoices, origin statements, supporting data) for broker submission



Support post-entry correction workflows and compliance audits



Ongoing compliance review of products to ensure correct HS codes and documentation for future shipments



Required Qualifications



Background in Customs Administration, Trade Compliance, or Customs Brokerage



Certified Customs Broker or equivalent formal certification



Practical experience with:



HS classification



Origin determination



Trade agreements (USMCA/CUSMA strongly preferred)



Comfortable with research-driven compliance work and regulatory interpretation



Strong attention to detail — accuracy is non-negotiable



Able to work independently in a remote environment



Nice to Have (Not Mandatory)



Direct experience with U.S. post-entry corrections



Exposure to industrial, utility, or technical products



Prior collaboration with U.S. customs brokers



Important Notes



This is not a training-only role. Broker oversight is provided, but you must be capable of producing compliant work with limited hand-holding.



Candidates with academic knowledge only and no applied experience should not apply.



This role may expand into a broader compliance function after the initial correction phase is completed.



How to Apply



Message me directly with:



Your certification details (country, issuing body, year)



A brief summary of your hands-on customs/compliance experience



Any experience you have with USMCA/CUSMA or post-entry corrections



Applicants who clearly demonstrate relevant experience will be prioritized.

title: Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist (Part-Time)



About Frontline Optics:

Frontline Optics is a premium eyewear brand built for First Responders. We focus on durability, function, and earning trust through authenticity—not hype. Our growth strategy prioritizes organic traffic, community engagement, and long-term brand loyalty over paid ads and discount-driven tactics.



The Role:

We are hiring an Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist to grow organic traffic, brand awareness, and non-paid revenue through authentic engagement and content across social and community-driven platforms.



This role is not about hard selling or spamming links. It’s about participating in conversations, providing value, and creating curiosity that naturally leads people to discover our brand.



Core Responsibilities:

• Schedule and post social media content

• Comment and engage on relevant Instagram and
 posts

• Participate meaningfully in
 Groups and 
 discussions  

• Write Reddit comments and threads that add value (no selling)  

• Repurpose existing brand content across platforms  

• Create short-form content for Instagram and TikTok  

• Suggest content ideas needed from the founder  

• Monitor comments and conversations and flag opportunities or issues  



Time split: ~60% engagement / ~40% content creation



Secondary Responsibilities

• Writing blog content (as needed)  

• Identifying trends and recurring conversation themes  



Brand Voice & Guidelines

• Educational, personal, insider tone  

• Speak naturally and authentically (training provided)  

• No competitor mentions  

• No discount pushing  

• No hard selling  

• Soft problem ? solution framing only  

• Donation mentions acceptable when relevant  

• No “hero” language  



Autonomy & Approval

• Pre-approved short engagement comments can be posted freely  

• Longer posts, educational threads, or personal storytelling require approval  

• When unsure ? ask for clarification  



KPIs & Success Metrics

Success is measured using a mix of hard metrics and directional trends:

• Organic website traffic growth  

• Lift in revenue not attributed to paid media  

• Referral traffic from social and community platforms  

• Engagement quality  

• Qualitative wins (mentions, screenshots, DMs)



Reporting cadence:

• Weekly summary  

• Monthly KPI deep dive  



Requirements (Must-Have)

• Prior experience with Instagram and
 brands  

• Prior Reddit brand participation  

• Comfortable clarifying content needs  

• Ability to repurpose images and B-roll  

• Strong written communication  

• Comfortable with US-based audiences  



Hours & Schedule

• 20–25 hours per week to start  

• Opportunity to scale  

• Small US overlap required  

• Start time: 6:00 AM Philippines time  



Compensation & Trial Period

• $6–$9 USD per hour  

• 90-day trial period  

• Rolling 90-day contracts if successful  

• Performance bonuses tied to KPIs  



Application Instructions

1. Review our website  

2. Submit a short recorded video explaining your organic growth strategy for the first 30, 60 and 90 days in detail.  Video should not exceed 5 minutes.   

3. Provide Resume with previous experience listed. 



Applications should be sent to 



Subject Line: Organic Growth and Community Marketing Specialist - {your name} 

***Applications without a recorded video will not be considered.***
