title: STREETWEAR/GRAFFITI/TYPO/WHATEVER WE SAY ARTIST
description:
Senior Multi-Disciplinary Brand & Design Architect



Direct Engagement | High-Discretion Role | Sophisticated Global Brand Environment



Position Overview



We are seeking an exceptionally advanced, culturally fluent, and execution-driven Brand & Design Architect to work directly with us on the ongoing design, evolution, and protection of our brand ecosystem.



This is not a freelance marketplace role and not a single-style designer position. You will operate as a trusted, embedded creative partner, working closely with ownership and leadership across luxury, streetwear, heritage, consumer, digital, and physical brand environments.



This role requires mastery of multiple visual languages, strategic thinking, elite execution, and an uncompromising standard of professionalism, discretion, and reliability.



We determine whether or not your work is on par and could then be published.



?



Nature of Engagement

 • You will work directly with us, not through intermediaries

 • You must be able to align with our working hours, timelines, and pace

 • High availability, responsiveness, and follow-through are expected

 • This role involves access to confidential brand strategy, unreleased designs, and proprietary materials

 • Absolute discretion and confidentiality are mandatory



This position is designed for designers who understand trust, long-term alignment, and high-stakes creative environments.



?



Core Responsibilities

 1. Brand Architecture & Visual Governance

 • Design, evolve, and protect cohesive brand systems across all touchpoints

 • Maintain visual consistency while enabling controlled stylistic range

 • Translate strategic direction into precise, repeatable execution

 2. Multi-Style Design Mastery

 • Confidently design across:

 • Luxury and elevated minimalism

 • Streetwear and cultural counterpoints

 • Heritage and archival-inspired systems

 • Mass-culture consumer branding

 • Experimental and future-forward aesthetics

 • Every stylistic decision must be intentional, justified, and controlled

 3. Product, Apparel & Drop-Based Design

 • Design graphics, typography, layouts, and treatments for apparel and products

 • Support limited drops, campaigns, and long-term collections

 • Design with real-world production, materials, and scalability in mind

 4. Digital & Physical Brand Execution

 • Create assets for websites, apps, social, campaigns, and motion environments

 • Extend brand language into retail, pop-ups, packaging, signage, and physical spaces

 • Ensure digital and physical expressions feel unified and deliberate

 5. Cultural Intelligence & Strategic Relevance

 • Maintain deep awareness of global fashion, art, music, and urban culture

 • Apply trends selectively and strategically, never impulsively

 • Prioritize longevity, credibility, and brand equity over short-term hype

 6. Collaboration & Professional Discipline

 • Work closely with leadership, marketing, production, and strategy teams

 • Present work clearly, confidently, and with rationale

 • Iterate efficiently without sacrificing quality or intent



?



Required Qualifications

 • Proven experience designing across multiple brand tiers and aesthetics

 • Advanced proficiency in professional design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)

 • Strong command of typography, layout systems, color theory, and composition

 • Experience delivering both digital and physical outputs

 • Ability to operate independently with minimal oversight

 • Exceptional attention to detail and execution quality

 • Strong communication skills and professional maturity



?



Portfolio Submission Requirements (Mandatory)



Applicants must submit a serious, well-curated portfolio demonstrating:

 • Clear range and versatility across distinct visual styles

 • Strategic thinking, including context and reasoning behind decisions

 • End-to-end execution, from concept through final output

 • Clear indication of your role and ownership in each project



Applications without a strong portfolio will not be considered.



?



Services & Capabilities Expected



You may be required to deliver:

 • Brand identity systems and visual guidelines

 • Apparel and product design assets

 • Campaign and launch visuals

 • Web and app design components

 • Retail and environmental branding

 • Packaging and physical collateral

 • Ongoing creative direction and visual oversight



?



Confidentiality, IP & Professional Standards

 • You must be extremely discreet regarding all work, communications, and materials

 • No work produced for us may be shared, published, reused, or referenced without explicit written permission

 • NDA, IP ownership, and confidentiality agreements will be required prior to engagement

 • This role demands absolute trust, discretion, and professionalism



?



Ideal Candidate



You are disciplined, culturally fluent, and strategically minded.

You understand that great design is not decoration — it is control, intention, and execution.

You are comfortable operating at a high level, under confidentiality, with long-term brand responsibility.



Exact Art & Design Styles Required (Non-Exhaustive)



The designer must demonstrate working mastery of the following specific, recognized art and design styles, with the ability to apply them appropriately across apparel, branding, digital, and physical environments:

 • Swiss / International Typographic Style

Grid-based systems, asymmetric layouts, objective typography, precision hierarchy, and clarity-driven composition.

 • Bauhaus & Modernist Design

Functional minimalism, geometric forms, primary color logic, and design driven by purpose rather than decoration.

 • Postmodern & Deconstructivist Design

Intentional rule-breaking, layered systems, visual tension, expressive typography, and controlled chaos.

 • Brutalist Graphic Design

Raw layouts, stark typography, high contrast, utilitarian structures, and anti-polish aesthetics.

 • Editorial & High-Fashion Art Direction

Magazine-driven composition, art-directed photography, typographic narrative, and visual pacing.

 • Luxury Minimalism

Extreme restraint, typographic refinement, tonal palettes, spacing discipline, and material sensitivity.

 • Streetwear & Underground Graphics

Poster culture, DIY aesthetics, cultural symbolism, stencil logic, graffiti-adjacent systems, and raw graphic expression.

 • Heritage / Archival Revival

Vintage typography, historical print methods, retro layouts, brand archaeology, and legacy reinterpretation.

 • Pop Art & Commercial Iconography

Bold color, repetition, simplified forms, mass-culture visual language, and instant recognizability.

 • Psychedelic & Experimental Graphics

Distorted typography, optical play, organic forms, layered visuals, and sensory-driven composition.

 • Futurist / Neo-Futurist Design

Motion-forward thinking, modular systems, technological aesthetics, and speculative visual language.

 • Minimalist Typography-First Systems

Type-led identity, hierarchy dominance, spacing control, and editorial logic over illustration.

 • Grunge & Raw Texture Design

Distress, imperfection, analog artifacts, and deliberate erosion of polish.

 • Conceptual & Art-Driven Design

Idea-first visuals, symbolism, reduction, and meaning embedded in form.

 • Campaign-Driven Visual Systems

Seasonal narratives, drop-based art direction, evolving visual arcs, and controlled variation.



?



Application Requirement

title: Project Operations Manager – Christian Technology Ministry
description:
Company Overview:

We're a US-based Christian foundation developing technology solutions for global ministry partners. Our mission is to equip indigenous believers worldwide with tools they can't access locally. We need a detail-oriented operations manager who thrives on systems, accuracy, and Kingdom impact.



Role Summary:

You'll be our "behind-the-scenes" operational backbone—managing project checklists, coordinating shipments, maintaining databases, and ensuring nothing falls through the cracks. You'll work directly with our founder (retired Navy officer, serial entrepreneur) ,who values precision and autonomous execution.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage project checklists and quality control processes

Coordinate international logistics and secure communications

Maintain detailed records and partner databases

Troubleshoot technical issues remotely

Track project metrics and prepare status reports

Scale operations as ministry partnerships grow

Requirements:



Faith: Committed evangelical Christian with a heart for missions

Personality: Detail-obsessed "finisher" who loves organization and systems (ISFJ/ISTJ MBTI; High S/High C DISC profile)

Experience: 2+ years of project coordination or operations management

Skills: Comfortable with basic technology, databases, and learning new software

Communication: Excellent written/spoken English; thick-skinned for direct feedback

Work Style: Highly autonomous; doesn't need hand-holding; 90%+ reliability

Not a Good Fit: High-energy social types, those needing constant direction, or detail-avoiders.



SCREENING QUESTIONS (Answer ALL in your first message):

Copy this format exactly:



Subject Line: "Operations Manager Application - [Your Full Name]"



1. Personal Faith:



What is your life verse and why did you choose it?

Briefly share your testimony (2-3 sentences)

2. Work Style & Personality:



Describe a time you completed a complex project with multiple moving parts. What was your system?

How do you handle receiving direct, blunt feedback?

When working on a team project, do you prefer to: (a) Lead the brainstorming, (b) Organize the details and timelines, (c) Motivate the team, or (d) Ensure quality standards? Explain why.

3. Decision Making & Pressure:



You have 5 urgent tasks due today, but can only complete 3. How do you d
 which ones to prioritize?

Describe your ideal work environment (noise level, interaction with people, workspace setup)

When facing a problem you've never seen before, what's your first instinct?

4. Missions Heart:



Have you been involved in mission work (local or international)? Describe briefly.

Why does supporting unreached peoples matter to you?

5. Technical & Learning:



Rate your comfort level (1-10) with learning new software/technology

Have you ever assembled computer hardware or managed technical projects?

Do you prefer detailed step-by-step instructions or general guidelines you can adapt?

Only complete applications following this format will be reviewed. We interview the top 5 candidates within one week.



Apply now if you're a steady, faithful finisher ready for Kingdom impact!

title: AI Creative Designer (Image Ads for Meta) – Functional Mushroom Brand
description:
Job Title



AI Creative Designer (Image Ads for Meta) – Functional Mushroom Brand



About the Role



We’re looking for a creative operator with hands-on experience using AI tools to generate image ads that actually perform.



You’ll be working with our functional mushroom brand, creating text-based image creatives for paid advertising—primarily on Meta 
 & Instagram). This role is not about abstract design or branding exercises. It’s about studying what already works in the market and producing high-converting image ads at speed.



You will:



Analyze competitor ad creatives



Recreate and adapt proven concepts using our brand, messaging, and direction



Bring your own ideas to the table and execute them



Iterate quickly based on performance feedback



We will provide:



Clear creative direction



Brand assets



Examples of ads we want duplicated or adapted



Ongoing feedback on what’s working



Responsibilities



Research competitor image ads from brands we compete with or supply



Identify common patterns in high-performing creatives (hooks, layouts, claims, visuals)



Create image ads using text-to-image tools such as:



Nano Banana Pro



ChatGPT (for prompts, concepts, copy, variations)



Design Meta-ready image ads (formats, ratios, clarity for mobile)



Recreate competitor-style ads using our branding and product positioning



Develop original creative concepts you believe will perform well



Produce multiple creative variations efficiently



Organize and deliver creatives clearly for ad testing



Required Skills & Experience



Proven experience creating image ads for Meta



Strong experience with AI-based image generation



Comfortable prompting and refining outputs (not one-click generation)



Understanding of direct-response ad principles



Ability to reverse-engineer competitor creatives



Strong attention to detail (readability, hierarchy, CTA clarity)



Ability to work independently and execute quickly



Nice to Have



Experience with health, supplement, or functional wellness brands



Familiarity with ad libraries and competitor research tools



Understanding of what Meta approves vs. flags (claims, wording, visuals)



Ability to suggest creative testing angles proactively



What This Is / Is Not



This is:



Performance-focused creative work



Execution-heavy, not theoretical



A role for someone who enjoys testing, iterating, and improving



This is not:



Logo design or brand identity work



Long-form video editing



A purely graphic design role with no ad context



How to Apply



Please include:



Examples of image ads you’ve created (especially Meta ads)



A brief explanation of your experience using AI image tools



(Optional but preferred) A short breakdown of how you’d approach recreating a competitor ad

Caregiver Training University powers the online learning courses and the Professional Association of Caregivers provides a supportive resource for caregivers. Named an Innovative company by Chicago Tribune.

dia is an emerging provider of marketing services. Our goal is to help local businesses gain more visibility and sales through innovative strategies. Now, we want to expand our own reach on Instagram to promote our services more effectively and generate new clients.

title: Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist – Full Time
description:
About Us



Structured Progress LLC is a US-based technology and low-voltage integration company providing security, networking, AV, and infrastructure services to commercial and residential clients. We are process-driven, documentation-focused, and committed to building a reliable remote support team.



We are seeking a full-time Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist to own invoicing, collections, and AR reporting while working closely with our operations and finance teams.



Role Summary



The AR Specialist is responsible for ensuring that completed work is invoiced accurately and on time, payments are collected according to agreed terms, and accounts receivable aging is actively managed.



This role focuses on billing accuracy, revenue capture, collections follow-up, and internal coordination. It does not include pricing decisions, bookkeeping, or accounts payable.



Key Responsibilities



Invoicing & Billing



Create customer invoices based on approved service tickets, completed work schedules, and approved estimates



Review invoices for accuracy, including customer details, rates, quantities, references, and sales tax



Ensure invoices are issued promptly after work completion



Collections & Customer Billing Support



Follow up on outstanding invoices according to defined AR aging schedules



Contact customers regarding open balances, payment status, and billing questions



Apply received payments and issue receipts



Escalate unresolved or overdue accounts per company guidelines



AR Aging & Reporting



Maintain accurate AR aging (30 / 60 / 90+)



Provide regular AR and collections reports



Identify at-risk accounts and overdue balances



Escalate accounts past agreed payment terms to management



Revenue Capture & Schedule Review



Review service schedules, PM updates, and completion logs



Identify completed but unbilled work



Coordinate with Project Managers and Dispatch to resolve billing gaps



Estimate Data Entry (Limited Scope)



Enter estimates exactly as provided by the Estimator



Ensure accuracy of line items, quantities, and descriptions



No pricing decisions or scope interpretation



Sales Tax Support



Prepare sales tax data and reports for review



Coordinate with the Bookkeeper for filing and submission



Ensure invoices reflect correct tax treatment based on provided guidance



Internal Coordination



Communicate with Project Managers, Dispatch, Operations, and the Bookkeeper



Support billing dispute resolution by providing documentation and invoice history



Maintain organized billing records and supporting documentation



What This Role Does NOT Do



Approve pricing, discounts, or payment terms



Modify scope, labor quantities, or materials



Negotiate contracts or scope disputes



Perform bookkeeping, reconciliations, AP, or payroll



Make operational or technical decisions



Required Qualifications



2+ years of experience in Accounts Receivable or billing



Strong understanding of invoicing, collections, and AR aging



Experience supporting service-based or project-based businesses



High attention to detail and accuracy



Strong written and verbal English communication skills



Comfortable working with multiple internal teams



Reliable internet connection and quiet work environment



Preferred Experience



Experience working with US-based companies



Familiarity with service tickets, work orders, and project billing



Basic understanding of sales tax concepts (support level)



Experience with accounting or invoicing software such as QuickBooks



Performance Expectations



Success in this role is measured by:



Timely issuance of invoices after work completion



AR aging kept within target ranges



Reduction in overdue balances



Accuracy of invoices and billing documentation



Consistent collections follow-up and escalation



Clear, professional communication with customers and internal teams



Compensation



Pay Range: PHP 60,000 – PHP 85,000 per month

Final compensation will be based on experience and demonstrated skill.



How to Apply



Please submit your application along with written answers to the questions below.

Applications without answers to these questions will not be reviewed.



Screening Questions (answer all):



How many years of hands-on Accounts Receivable experience do you have, and in what type of business (service-based, project-based, or product-based)?



Describe your experience creating invoices. What information do you check to ensure an invoice is accurate before sending it to a customer?



How do you typically handle follow-ups on overdue invoices (30, 60, 90+ days)?



Have you worked with US-based customers before? If yes, describe your experience communicating about billing or collections.



What accounting or invoicing software have you used (for example, QuickBooks)? Briefly describe your level of experience.



How do you handle situations where work was completed but billing information is missing or unclear?



Are you comfortable working full time with required overlap during US business hours? Please confirm.



What is your expected monthly salary in PHP?



Final Note



This is a structured, process-driven role. Accuracy, documentation, and consistency are valued more than speed. If you are comfortable following defined processes and working closely with operations and finance teams, we encourage you to apply.

title: Account Manager (Virtual Assistant)
description:
As a key tea
mber of Caregiverlist, Inc., you will directly impact customer experience by nurturing our current business-to-business clients through the delivery of exceptional support and service. As an expert on our services, you will host Webinar Demo’s of our digital services to new warm-inquiry and cold prospects.. As part of our CARETeam, you will build rapport with our clients, engaging directly with them to understand their training needs, monitor their account activity and review their accounts to make sure they are maximizing their subscriptions by initiating all of our digital branding tools and assisting with subscription renewals. Caregivers are required to be trained annually in most states in the U.S.A., and you will learn the state training requirements to support our clients with their subscription purchases and renewals. You will join the Caregiverlist® CareTeam and receive the highest quality customer service training to perform as part of our collaborative and supportive culture that values caregiving, creativity, innovation, integrity and growth. We treat our customers like family (you actually love).



Job Duties Include:

- Mastering the Caregiver Training University online Learning Management System (LMS)

- Assist current and future senior care companies to provide our state-approved training courses to their staff and meet all necessary reporting requirements

- Provide exceptional customer service by answering inbound calls and
 inquiries from our b-to-b clients

- Proactively follow-up with new prospects and warm inquiries to qualify, and cultivate new prospects through referrals from current clients and industry relationships.

- Schedule Webinar Demos for new prospective subscribers

- Guide new clients through the onboarding process following successful sales transactions

- Maintain relationship with current clients, keeping them engaged with our trusted brand

- Develop and implement e-mail communication to current clients (and video communications when appropriate) to maintain engagement   

- Develop account plans and strategies, in conjunction with management, to deliver customized proposals to corporate franchises and large companies and business development partners

- Collaborate with internal teams, such as marketing and product development, to align strategies and deliver comprehensive solutions to clients.

- Learn and implement our Copper CRM system, including implementing reports to identify client subscription renewals and new opportunities

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of sales activities and client interactions in the CRM system.

- Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to identify growth opportunities  

- Develop expertise in our industries: senior home care and digital marketing



Qualifications for the Sales Account Manager Role:

- College degree preferred

- Excellent English Communication Skills

- Experience in a customer support or customer-facing role using
, phone, chat support and account management

- Possess a goal-driven mindset and desire to succeed in a fast-growth environment, with a willingness to work towards achieving targets and receiving commission.

- Computer savvy

- Zen: You can handle stressful situations with a calm and helpful attitude.

- Guidance: Help our customers discover how to get the most value from our product with helpful tips and resources.

- Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to proactively listen while juggling multiple tasks to meet client needs in a fast-paced digital environment.  Be able to confidently ask questions and shift gears quickly when needed. As a digital product, we are race car drivers, not row-row-row-your-boaters.

- Detail-Oriented: STRONG attention to detail and ability to multitask

- Passion: You enjoy resolving issues and have a strong belief in good, genuine customer service.

- While Senior care industry knowledge is helpful, it is not required as long as you possess compassion for seniors.  We are in a growing industry as the oldest age is 115. 

- Be a team player and willing to learn and grow with your CARETea
mbers possessing a “can do” attitude.



What’s in it for you:

- Part-time position: 8 am cst - 1 pm cst

- Working Schedule: Mondays ~ Fridays

- Fully-remote (Work-from-Home)

- Initial offer of $5 per hour with Opportunity to Earn Commission

- Be a part of a Global Digital Media Company

- Informal, Results-Driven culture

- Experienced leadership team to help you develop and grow

- Entrepreneurial atmosphere

- Attend Training Webinars and Virtual Events 

- Interact with the Latest Marketing Technology

- Co-working environment to learn from other businesses

- Flexible working environment



Technical Requirements:



- Must be located in Metro-Manila or an area with reliable electricity

- Access to stable internet connection

- Working laptop or desktop (intel core i5, amd ryzen3, amd ryzen5 or higher)

- Noise Canceling Headset

- Must have back-ups for connection and power lost

- Preferable with Quite Workspace



To apply, please send your resume along with a portfolio or samples of your work (if applicable). In the subject line of your message, write: VA Account Manager [Your Name – Your Location].



Maintains kindness and integrity in upholding Caregiverlist® mission of providing the highest quality online resource to plan and train for senior care.





About Caregiverlist®:





Caregiverlist® provides online tools for the senior care industry, including e-learning programs matching state requirements, directories of resources, costs of care, and business-to-business digital training, hiring, and lead solutions. Caregiver Training University powers the online learning courses

title: Senior TikTok Shop Affiliate Outreach Manager (US Market)
description:
**[About the Role]**

We are a premium K-Beauty brand specializing in professional aesthetic and anti-aging skincare (Wrinkle Tox 5D Shot). We are looking for a high-performing TikTok Shop Affiliate Outreach Manager to scale our US presence. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of identifying top-tier skincare influencers and driving significant revenue through strategic partnerships.



**[Key Responsibilities]**



- **Massive Outreach & Discovery:** Identify and reach out to 2,000+ targeted skincare influencers per month.

- **Precise Targeting:** Focus on influencers within the skincare/beauty niche who have generated over $5,000 in revenue in the last 30 days.

- **End-to-End Communication:** Manage all communications via TikTok DM,
, and SNS. Craft personalized, high-converting invitation messages.

- **Creative Guidance:** Provide influencers with "Creative Hooks" and "Visual Guides" to ensure their content aligns with our premium aesthetic image and drives sales.

- **Post Management:** Monitor sample delivery, track upload status, and proactively encourage influencers to post high-quality content on time.

- **Reporting:** Maintain a daily/weekly tracker of outreach volume, response rates, and GMV performance.



**[Qualifications]**



- **Experience:** Minimum 1-2 years of direct experience in US TikTok Shop Affiliate management (Experience in the beauty/skincare industry is a huge plus).

- **Full-Time Commitment:** Ability to work 8 hours a day (aligned with US or KST time zone as discussed).

- **Communication:** Native-level written English with the ability to build rapport with influencers.

- **Data-Driven:** Proficient in TikTok analytics tools (e.g., KaloData, FastMoss, EchoTik).

- **Proactive Attitude:** A self-starter who doesn't just "send messages" but "closes deals" and drives revenue.



**[Performance Bonus & Perks]**



- Competitive base salary.

- **Performance-based Incentives:** Additional bonuses for reaching GMV targets and high-performing video uploads.

- Opportunity to lead our expansion into the Southeast Asian (SEA) TikTok Shops for top performers.

title: Google Veo 3 Specialist
description:
We’re Hiring: Google Veo 3 Specialist



Our fast-growing e-commerce brand is scaling toward 8-figures and beyond, and we’re ready to level up our creative production with the power of Google Veo 3. We’re looking for a Google Veo 3 Specialist to help us manage, refine, and execute AI-generated video ads that support our marketing goals.



To show you’ve carefully read this post, please start your response with the word peach before introducing yourself. Below, you’ll find the key responsibilities, requirements, and a few quick questions so we can get to know your experience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Prompt Creation & Optimization: Write, test, and refine prompts to generate high-quality video ads using Google Veo 3.

- Workflow Coordination: Manage the full AI production pipeline—concept to final output—ensuring deadlines are met.

- Creative Alignment: Collaborate with our marketing and UGC teams to blend AI-generated content with human-made assets.

- Quality Review: Ensure all outputs are polished, on-brand, and ready for launch.

- Innovation & Mastery: Stay up to date with Google Veo 3 features, updates, and best practices to keep us ahead of the curve.

- Documentation: Maintain a clear system for tracking prompts, revisions, and final deliverables.



Requirements:

- Hands-on experience with Google Veo 3 and AI video generation.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to manage multiple creative projects at once.

- Good communication skills for working with both AI and human creators.

- Comfortable using project management tools like Google Sheets, Notion, or similar.

- Consistent availability for 4-8 hours daily, 6 days per week.

- Bonus: Background in marketing, video production, or AI prompt engineering.



Questions for You:

- Have you worked directly with Google Veo 3 before? If so, tell us about your projects.

- How do you approach prompt testing and refining to get the best results?

- What’s your system for keeping multiple AI video projects organized?

- Are you comfortable balancing both creative expectations and technical workflows?

- Can you commit to 4-8 hours per day, 6 days per week, for this role?



If you’re passionate about AI-powered creativity and love working with cutting-edge tools like Google Veo 3, we’d love to hear from you!

title: OPERATIONS MANAGER
description:
Operations & Growth Coordinator

StressKnotNYC — Remote | Full-Time



This is not a typical admin role.

We’re looking for a high-ownership operator who can manage fulfillment AND help grow the business when things are quiet.

You will be the bridge between clients, therapists, and revenue.



When bookings are active, you focus on fulfillment.

When things slow down, you switch into growth mode.



About StressKnotNYC

StressKnotNYC is a premium in-home massage and wellness company serving New York City and surrounding areas. We connect high-quality clients with elite licensed therapists and are rapidly scaling.



We are building a strong operations engine and need someone who can help us run daily operations while also helping us grow.





Your job is simple:

Make sure every client gets taken care of

Make sure therapists are supported

Help bring in more therapists + more clients when things are slow



This role is:

Operations + Recruitment + Outreach + Revenue Support



Primary Responsibilities

1) Fulfillment (Top Priority)



When bookings are active, this comes first.

Answer calls, texts, and
s from clients

Coordinate and schedule massage sessions

Match clients with available therapists

Confirm appointments

Send reminders to clients and therapists

Handle reschedules and cancellations

Support therapists 

Follow up with clients after sessions

Request reviews and referrals

You are the control center of daily operations.



2) Therapist Recruitment (When Fulfillment Is Slow)



When inquiries are quiet, switch to building the therapist pipeline.



Source licensed massage therapists

Screen candidates

Schedule interviews

Follow up with applicants

Track candidate pipeline

Help onboard new therapists



Goal: Always keep the therapist bench growing.



3) Business Outreach (When Fulfillment Is Slow)



Help bring in corporate and local business opportunities.

Reach out to local businesses

Send
s and make outreach calls

Track responses

Set meetings for leadership



Goal: Build relationships that turn into revenue.



4) Client Reactivation (When Fulfillment Is Slow)



Help generate income from past clients.

Reach out to past clients

Send follow-up
s/texts

Check in and encourage rebooking

Promote new services and availability



Goal: Turn old clients into repeat clients.



The Type of Person We're Looking For



Take ownership

Stay organized without being told

Communicate clearly and professionally

Are comfortable speaking on the phone

Can switch between tasks quickly

Care about results, not just checking boxes

Think like an operator AND a problem-solver

This role requires someone who can stay productive even when it’s quiet.



What Success Looks Like



Making sure no client inquiry is missed

Keeping therapists scheduled and supported

Bringing in new therapist candidates

Helping create new business opportunities

Re-engaging past clients

You are helping the business run AND grow.



Required Skills

Strong English communication

Customer service experience

Comfortable on phone calls

Organized and detail-oriented

Able to multitask

Reliable and responsive

Bonus if you have experience with:

Scheduling/dispatching

Recruiting

Cold outreach

CRM systems



Work Structure

This is a priority-based role:



When fulfillment is busy ? focus on clients & therapists

When fulfillment is slow ? switch to growth tasks:



Recruitment

Business outreach

Client reactivation



Please submit a short video introduction (1–2 minutes) answering the following:

Why are you interested in working with StressKnotNYC?

title: Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist – Shopify Fashion (Part-Time)
description:
We operate and scale multiple fashion ecommerce dropshipping brands on Shopify, promoted organically on TikTok.



Our brands are growing fast, and as traffic increases, small improvements in conversion rate and AOV make a significant difference in overall revenue.



Due to growth, we are strengthening our website performance with a CRO-focused Shopify specialist responsible for continuously improving our stores through testing and execution.



This role is execution-focused, data-driven, and long-term.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will be responsible for owning and improving website conversion performance across our Shopify stores.



This is not a design role and not a marketing strategy role.

Your focus is implementation, testing, and optimization.



You will work closely with our
 marketer to ensure website offers and structure support ongoing campaigns and promotions.



Your responsibilities include:



-Auditing Shopify stores to identify conversion bottlenecks

-Implementing a fashion-optimized Shopify theme and improving site structure

-Optimizing key pages:

       -Homepage

       -Collection pages

       -Product pages

       -Cart and checkout



-Implementing and testing:

       -upsells

       -bundles

       -cross-sells



-Running A/B tests or structured comparisons (themes, layouts, offers, modules)

-Improving clarity, trust, speed, and user flow

-Ensuring on-site offers align with
 campaigns and promotions

-Executing website changes and ideas provided by the founder and testing their impact

-Tracking conversion-related metrics and reporting results



This role requires attention to detail, structured thinking, and comfort with experimentation.



REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT)



You should have:



-Strong hands-on experience working with Shopify stores

-Experience implementing and modifying paid Shopify themes

-Practical experience with conversion rate optimization (not theory only)

-Experience optimizing product pages, carts, and checkout flows

-Experience implementing upsells, bundles, or cross-sells

-Familiarity with Shopify apps related to CRO and AOV

-Ability to run and evaluate A/B tests or controlled comparisons

-Basic HTML / CSS knowledge (JavaScript is a plus)

-Ability to work independently and follow a testing roadmap

-Strong communication and documentation skills



We are looking for someone methodical, curious, and focused on measurable improvements.



WHAT WE OFFER



-Hourly rate: 7 – 8 USD/hour (based on experience)

-Part-time role (approximately 15–20 hours per week)

-Flexible working hours (as long as responsibilities and tests are delivered)

-Long-term collaboration for the right profile

-Opportunity to work on multiple growing fashion brands



We value consistency, ownership, and long-term collaboration.



HOW TO APPLY (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)



To apply, please:



1) Change your application subject to:

“I want to optimize your website O”

2) Send your CV

3) Send a Loom video (3–5 minutes)



In your Loom, please explain:



-Your experience optimizing Shopify stores for conversion rate or AOV

-One concrete example of a CRO change or test you implemented and its result

-How you d
 what to test first on a Shopify store

-Which Shopify apps or theme features you commonly use for CRO

-How you work with marketers 
 or paid traffic) to align offers on-site



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

You will be working directly with the owner and internal team to manage guest communication, support operations, and help scale the business.



This position requires excellent English communication skills, strong customer service experience, and comfort working with multiple software tools. Airbnb or short-term rental experience is strongly preferred, and candidates who have worked directly with Airbnb or similar platforms will be prioritized.

• Strong customer service background

• Airbnb or short-term rental experience preferred

• Strong, stable, high-speed internet connection

• Fast, reliable computer capable of handling multiple tools at once

• Quiet, professional, distraction-free work environment

WORKING HOURS

BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED BUT A PLUS)

title: Financial Analyst / Bookkeeper – Ecommerce / Shopify (Part-Time)
description:
We run a growing fashion ecommerce dropshipping business operating on Shopify.



Our business is relatively simple from a financial structure standpoint (two Shopify stores, Shopify Payments, PayPal, and a limited number of bank accounts), but having clean, accurate monthly financial reporting is critical as we scale.



We are looking for a part-time Financial Analyst / Bookkeeper who can take ownership of our monthly P&L, ensure everything is properly reconciled, and give us clear financial visibility.



This is a small but important role. We are looking for someone experienced, autonomous, and reliable.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



You will be responsible for building and maintaining clean monthly financial reports for our ecommerce business.



Your responsibilities include:



-Preparing a monthly P&L for our Shopify stores

-Tracking and reconciling:

-revenue per store

-COGS (supplier invoices)

-refunds and chargebacks

-payment processor fees (Shopify Payments, PayPal)



-Consolidating data from:

-Shopify

-Shopify Payments

-PayPal

-bank accounts



-Ensuring numbers are accurate, consistent, and properly categorized

-Maintaining and improving Google Sheets used for financial reporting

-Flagging inconsistencies, missing data, or anomalies proactively

-Providing a clear, easy-to-read snapshot of monthly profitability



This role is focused on accuracy, structure, and clarity, not volume.



REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT)



You should have:



-Proven experience with ecommerce or dropshipping bookkeeping / finance

-Experience building monthly P&L statements for ecommerce businesses

-Strong Google Sheets skills (formulas, structure, clean layouts)



-Understanding of:

-ecommerce revenue flows

-supplier invoices and COGS

-refunds and chargebacks

-payment processor fees

-High attention to detail and consistency

-Ability to work independently and take ownership

-Comfortable questioning numbers if something does not make sense



This role is not for beginners or general VAs.

We are looking for someone who can do this properly and professionally.



WORK SETUP



-Part-time (a few hours per month, mainly end-of-month)

-Long-term collaboration

-Fully remote

-Flexible schedule (as long as monthly reporting is delivered on time)



COMPENSATION



-$100 USD per month retainer

-Paid monthly

-Scope and compensation can be reviewed in the future if complexity increases



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, please follow these steps carefully:



1) Change your application subject to:

I want to work for you O

2) Send your CV

3) Answer the following question (5–8 lines):



-How would you structure a monthly P&L for a Shopify dropshipping business using Shopify Payments and PayPal, with supplier invoices, refunds, and processor fees?



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Content creator and brand design
description:
We are jYU Studios, a small, high-taste content and social media studio. We manage social media strategy and content for a handful of clients across Instagram and LinkedIn. Run by me and my partner, our clients love our vibe and style of our content. Our clients come to us for our highly-personable approach, and we need help to keep the positivity growing.



I would humbly say our work is known for strong aesthetic, restraint, and emotion-first storytelling. We do not chase trends or viral formulas. We try our best to focus on quality, mood, and premium brand feel.



We are hiring a remote Creative Content Designer to help us serve this same flavor to more people. You will not need to shoot content and you will not have access to client social media accounts. Your role is to package content and design static posts so we can post quickly and consistently.



What you will do



Static post design and Video editing (main focus)

Design carousels, quote posts, announcements, and clean branded templates

Create multiple variations when needed (cover options, layout options)

Use client brand fonts and guidelines consistently

Content packaging and repurposing

Turn our reels into supporting assets (story cut frames, cover thumbnails, teaser statics, LinkedIn-friendly visuals)

Prepare ready-to-post kits: final exports, captions in a doc, hashtags, tagging notes, posting instructions

Light strategy support (fast and practical)

Weekly mini insights: what worked, what to repeat, what to avoid



File hygiene and delivery system

Organize assets cleanly in Google Drive

Follow naming conventions and version control



Deliver on time, every time



Tools we use: 

Canva (heavy)

Capcut/Davinci

Adobe (Photoshop or Illustrator) as needed

Google Drive



What we care about:



Honestly, if you are interested in growing and learning and is a good hang we are sold.

Formally, what we care about is taste, clean design fundamentals: spacing, hierarchy, typography, restraint, personable attitude

Ability to match different brand vibes (still premium, still clean)

Speed plus quality. Coachability: you can take feedback and improve fast

Organization: your files and exports are always clean and easy to use



Requirements



Strong portfolio of clean, premium social media design (carousels and statics)

Confident in Canva and Capcut, and comfortable with Adobe tools when needed

Strong English, Good communication

Reliable internet and consistent availability

A love for music is a big plus! 



Not required



Shooting content

Posting content

Account management or client calls



How to apply



Reply with:



Your portfolio link (your best work)

2 examples of your best carousel work and why you chose them

Your Canva skill level (1 to 10)

Your expected monthly rate for 20 hours per week

Confirm you are comfortable with Google Drive organization and file naming rules





If you love clean design, premium brand work, and want to grow with a small studio, we would love to meet you.

title: Freelance Video Editor (Social Media & Ads)
description:
Freelance Video Editor (Social Media & Ads)



Location: Remote

Type: Freelance / Project-Based

Pay: Per project (based on scope and complexity)



About the Role:



D&D Lawn Co. is looking for a high-level freelance video editor to help us create engaging short-form videos for social media and paid ads.



This role is strictly for editors who know how to:

- Edit fast-paced, attention-grabbing videos

- Cut for retention (hooks, pacing, captions)

- Make content that performs on platforms like Instagram,
, and TikTok



We are not looking for beginners. We are looking for someone who is already very good at video editing.



What You’ll Be Editing:

- Short-form social media videos

- Video ads

- Promotional clips

- Branded content

- Most videos will be short (15–60 seconds) and focused on performance, not just aesthetics.



Requirements (Please Read Carefully):

You must meet all of the following:

- Strong video editing skills (short-form content)

- Experience editing videos for social media and ads

- Good English communication skills

- Able to understand instructions and feedback clearly

- Reliable and responsive communication

- Strong attention to detail

- Comfortable working on deadlines



If you do not already have strong editing skills, this role will not be a good fit.





Pay Structure:

- Paid on a per-project basis

- Rates will be discussed based on quality, speed, and complexity

- High-quality editors will receive consistent work over time



Application Process (Required):

- To apply, you must submit a short video or link showing your best editing work.



Please include:

- A brief introduction

- A link to your best video editing samples

- A short explanation of what type of videos you enjoy editing most

- Applications without video samples will not be considered.



Test Project:



After reviewing your samples, shortlisted candidates will be given a paid test project.



This helps us evaluate:

- Editing quality

- Style

- Speed

- Ability to follow direction



Only editors who perform well on the test project will be offered ongoing work.



Final Note:

We are only looking for really good video editors who take pride in their work and want to produce content that performs.

If you’re confident in your skills and want consistent freelance work, we’d love to see your portfolio.



—

D&D Lawn Co.

title: Social Media Coordinator (Real Estate)
description:
We are a real estate media company that works with realtors, providing professional photography, video, and marketing media to support their listings and personal brands.



We already create strong photos and videos for our clients. The challenge isn’t content, it’s follow-through.



Between listings, showings, and day-to-day work, social media often falls behind. This role exists to quietly keep things moving so our clients get more value from the media they’ve invested in.



This is a coordination and execution role, not a strategy or content-creation position.



-----



What You’ll Do



Client Social Media (Primary)

 • Schedule and publish social media posts using existing photos, videos, and templates

 • Repurpose listing media into ready-to-post content

 • Keep multiple client accounts organized and posting consistently

 • Communicate with clients in a friendly, professional way

 • Prompt clients when content or approvals are needed

 • Keep things moving without overcomplicating them



Our Own Social Media (Secondary)

 • Help keep our company’s social media active and consistent

 • Coordinate with the team to gather content

 • Encourage regular posting and follow-through



Client Coordination (Set Hours)

 • Be available 2:00 PM – 7:00 PM EST for client communication (Social Media & Other)

 • Support basic scheduling and coordination questions

 • Accurately enter and update client requests in our system



-----



What Matters Most in This Role

 • Staying organized across many small tasks

 • Clear, calm written communication

 • Reliability and follow-through

 • Comfort managing multiple clients at once

 • Knowing when content is “good to go” — not perfect



You do not need to:

 • Write long-form captions from scratch

 • Build systems or workflows

 • Own social media strategy



-----



Tools & Experience

 • Experience using Meta Business Suite (required)

 • Experience coordinating or scheduling social media (required)

 • Real estate or media experience is a plus, but not required



-----



Compensation & Time Off

 • Full-time, long-term remote role

 • Competitive vacation time

 • Paid time off over the Christmas and New Year’s holiday period

 • 13th Month pay, in line with standard Philippine employment practices



-----



This Role Is a Good Fit If You:

 • Enjoy keeping things organized and on track

 • Like working with people in a supportive, professional way

 • Prefer clear expectations over constant reinvention

 • Are comfortable following systems and routines

 • Want stable, long-term remote work



-----



Application Instructions



To apply, please include:

 • Reference code: RAFE04

 • A brief creative reference to a purple elephant

 • 3–5 sentences describing:

 • A routine or process you managed

 • How you stayed organized

 • How you knew it was working



Applications missing these items will not be reviewed.

title: Full-Time Marketing Virtual Assistant (Google Ads, Website, Team Collaboration) – US Hours

Website tasks: Building and maintaining WordPress websites using our premium themes and plugins, installing and configuring plugins, fixing bugs and performing maintenance, creating/editing landing pages, and posting content to Google Business Profile (GBP) and social media.

Supporting other marketing tasks as assigned by the team.

All work is collaborative , you'll interact daily with the team via Zoom calls, Slack/ chat tools, and shared projects.

Required Skills and Experience:

Fluent English (written and spoken) - must be comfortable in video calls and team discussions.

Proven experience with Google Ads (search, demand gen, optimization).

Strong WordPress skills (building sites, plugins, landing pages, troubleshooting).

Comfortable working US business hours (EST/PST time zones).

Reliable, proactive, team-oriented, and detail-focused.

Tools Experience (Rate Yourself 1-10 for Each):

Please reply with your self-rating (1 = beginner, 10 = expert) for the following tools/tasks:

Google Ads: Keyword research

Google Ads: Setting up Search campaigns

Google Ads: Setting up Demand Gen campaigns

Google Ads: Optimizing accounts

Google Analytics

Google Search Console

CallRail

GoHighLevel

SpyFu

Ahrefs

Also let us know:

Any other professional marketing tools you use regularly (e.g., SEMrush,
 Ads Manager, etc.) and your skill level (1-10).

Your portfolio: Links to landing pages you've built, websites you've worked on, or Google Ads campaign examples/screenshots (if available this is highly preferred).

Trial Period & Compensation:

First month: 5 hours per day, Monday to Friday (25 hours/week) at $8 per hour.

Based on performance and fit, top performers will transition to full-time (50 hours/week) at $9 per hour.

Employees who demonstrate special skills or deliver exceptional results will receive bonuses and potential higher offers.

This is a long-term opportunity for the right person , we value growth, reliability, and team players.

To Apply:

Reply with:

Your self-ratings (1-10) for the tools/tasks listed above.

Any additional tools + ratings.

Links to your portfolio or examples of work.

A brief note on why you're a great fit for a team-based marketing role with daily Zoom communication.

Your current availability for US hours.

We review applications carefully and respond to qualified candidates. Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Local SEO Strategist // Manager
description:
Job Description:



We are looking for a Local SEO Strategist to join our small, boutique agency. We are focused on helping local businesses grow their presence in local search and Google Maps. We are very hands-on and you’ll be working very closely with our lead SEO. If you have a proven track record of increasing local search results for businesses, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities:



- Conduct Comprehensive Website Audits: Auditing websites for technical issues, errors, and opportunities is a critical part of the SEO process as it sets the foundation and path moving forward. These audits should be very detailed and include actionable recommendations regarding: Competition, On-page, Off-page, Technical, and Local (GBP).

- SEO Strategy and Planning: Establish a detailed strategy for each business based on its current online presence, goals, and the competition in its niche. The Strategy should include detailed recommendations for a 6-month/12-month SEO Campaign, broken down by what should be done each month.

- Monitor and Track Results: Create and maintain a process for tracking the results of our SEO efforts. Report results in a clear fashion so they can be shared with clients.



Qualifications Required:



- Extensive Local SEO Background: Proven expertise in Local SEO, supported by a portfolio that showcases successful local search campaigns.

- SEO Best-Practices: In-depth knowledge of SEO best practices, Google’s algorithms, and local search ranking factors.

- SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures): Must have standardized processes and procedures to apply to local seo projects that incorporate SEO best practices.

- SEO Tools: A master of key SEO software and tools such as Google Analytics, Ahrefs, ScreamingFrog, RankMath, and more.

- Strong Communication Skills: Clear communication is key, even when the message you’re delivering isn’t good news.

Analytical Mind: Analyzing SEO data and leveraging insights to refine strategies for optimum outcomes is very important.



Application Process:



** Please only apply if you are qualified and your MAIN skillset is LOCAL SEO. We are looking for true experts, not beginners. **



To apply: 



Please forward your resume along with:



- Completed Audits, SEO Strategy Plans, Audit Templates

- Examples and results of your work with Local SEO campaigns

- Anything else you think will show us you are the #1 pick for this position

title: CRO Expert - Ecommerce
description:
We’re looking for an experienced A/B Testing & Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist to help us scale our e-commerce brands through data-driven experimentation.



You’ll be responsible for planning, executing, and analyzing A/B tests across landing pages, product pages, offers, creatives, and funnels — turning insights into clear, actionable improvements.



Experience in the beauty or skincare niche is a strong bonus.



What You’ll Do

Design and run A/B and multivariate tests across:

Product pages (PDPs)

Landing pages

Funnels & checkout flows

Offers, pricing, and bundles

Copy, layouts, and UX elements

Develop clear test hypotheses based on data, user behavior, and psychology

Analyze results and translate data into clear recommendations

Prioritize tests based on potential impact and effort

Collaborate with design, marketing, and content teams

Continuously improve conversion rates, AOV, and revenue



What We’re Looking For:

Proven experience running high-volume A/B tests for e-commerce brands

Strong understanding of CRO, user behavior, and conversion psychology

Hands-on experience with A/B testing and analytics tools (e.g. GA4, Hotjar, VWO, Convert, Optimizely, or similar)

Ability to explain results clearly — not just the numbers, but the why

Detail-oriented, structured, and highly analytical

Self-driven and comfortable owning experiments end-to-end



Nice to Have (Bonus):

Experience in beauty, skincare, or wellness e-commerce

Experience using Intelligems (pricing tests, offers, bundles, subscriptions)

Familiarity with Shopify ecosystems

Experience optimizing for Meta Ads / TikTok traffic

Understanding of subscription models and bundles

Experience working with UGC-driven funnels



Please send us your portfolio link when you apply.



Thanks!

title: Senior Performance Marketing Specialist (Meta Ads + Google Ads) – 5+ Years Experience Only
description:
We are looking for a highly experienced Senior Performance Marketing Specialist who has deep, hands-on expertise in both Meta Ads and Google Ads. This role is strictly for professionals with a minimum of 5+ years of proven experience managing and scaling profitable eCommerce ad accounts.



This is not an entry-level or learning role. We are looking for someone who can design the right strategy, execute it independently, and scale campaigns responsibly with a strong focus on low cost per purchase and sustainable growth.



Key Responsibilities



You will be responsible for planning, executing, optimizing, and scaling paid advertising campaigns across Meta Ads 
 & Instagram) and Google Ads (Search, Shopping, Performance Max). Your role includes full-funnel strategy creation, creative testing direction, audience and keyword structuring, conversion tracking validation, and continuous performance improvement focused on orders and CPA, not just clicks or impressions.



Required Experience & Skills (Strictly Mandatory)



Applicants must have a minimum of 5+ years of real, hands-on experience running both Meta Ads and Google Ads for eCommerce brands. You should have strong experience with conversion-focused campaign structures, creative testing frameworks, scaling strategies, CPA control, and budget optimization. You must clearly understand the difference between traffic, leads, and purchase intent, and know how to build campaigns that generate consistent daily orders.



You should be comfortable working independently, analyzing data daily, taking ownership of performance, and making strategic decisions without hand-holding.



What We Are NOT Looking For



We are not looking for beginners, trainees, interns, or anyone with less than 5 years of experience. We are also not interested in marketers who promise “guaranteed sales” without understanding product, pricing, and conversion factors. If your focus is only on impressions, likes, or vanity ROAS numbers, this role is not for you.



What We Expect From You



You should be able to build a clear, structured growth plan, explain how you will scale from lower volumes to higher daily orders, and demonstrate how you control cost per purchase while scaling. You should be confident in explaining your strategy, decision-making process, and past results with real examples.



Why Work With Us



You will work with a serious, growth-focused eCommerce business that values long-term performance, clean data, and strategic decision-making. This is a role for someone who wants ownership, stability, and the opportunity to scale campaigns properly — not chase short-term wins.



Application Instructions (Very Important)



When applying, do not send generic proposals. Start your application by clearly mentioning:



Your total years of experience in Meta Ads and Google Ads



Types of eCommerce accounts you have handled



Your role in scaling campaigns and controlling CPA



One example of a structured strategy you personally executed



Applications that do not clearly show senior-level experience will not be considered.

title: Production Graphic Designer – Vector Artwork / Laser File Prep (FULL TIME)
description:
JOB TITLE:

Production Graphic Designer – Vector Artwork / Laser File Prep (FULL TIME)



JOB TYPE:

Full-Time, Long-Term

Remote



IMPORTANT – PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING



This is NOT a junior role.

This is NOT a training position.

ONLY experienced, production-level designers should apply.



If you do not have real-world experience converting customer-provided artwork into clean, production-ready vector files at HIGH VOLUME, please do not apply.



ABOUT THE ROLE



We are a high-volume manufacturing company producing custom rubber stamps using laser engraving equipment. We process HUNDREDS of orders every day.



This role is strictly focused on production artwork preparation, not creative design.



Your primary responsibility will be vectorization and print / laser file preparation. This includes converting customer-provided artwork such as signatures, logos, and text into clean, production-ready vector files suitable for laser engraving.



Speed, accuracy, and consistency are critical. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, production-driven environment and delivering a high volume of completed files every day.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES (ESSENTIAL)



• Vectorization and print / laser file preparation

• Accurately converting customer-provided artwork into production-ready vectors

• Following detailed instructions and file standards precisely

• Strong comprehension skills and ability to execute exactly as instructed

• Extremely high attention to detail (this is essential)

• Working efficiently at scale in a high-volume production environment

• Adapting quickly to workflow requirements and internal processes



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



• Strong experience with vector-based design software

• Experience converting raster artwork and signatures into clean vectors

• Experience preparing files for laser engraving, CNC, or similar production workflows

• Ability to work quickly and accurately under production pressure

• Highly detail-oriented with consistent output quality



SOFTWARE EXPERIENCE



• CorelDRAW experience is strongly preferred

• Adobe Illustrator experience is acceptable, provided you can adapt quickly to CorelDRAW

• We do NOT provide training for vector fundamentals or production artwork concepts

• We will train on our specific workflow and internal systems only



You are expected to already understand vectorization, contours, node editing, and production-ready file setup.



INTERVIEW PROCESS



If you appear qualified, an initial interview will be conducted by a member of our team (not the owner) to evaluate technical ability, comprehension, attention to detail, and overall professional fit.



HOW TO APPLY



When applying, please include:

1. A brief summary of your experience with production artwork and vector conversion

2. The design software you are most experienced with (CorelDRAW, Adobe Illustrator, etc.)

3. Any relevant examples of laser-ready or production artwork (if available)



Applications that do not clearly demonstrate relevant production experience may not receive a response.



ONLY QUALIFIED CANDIDATES SHOULD APPLY.

title: Operations Lead – Service Accommodation + Contractor Coordination
description:
We are a UK-based property investment and serviced accommodation (SA) management company. We operate seven serviced accommodation units and focus on delivering a consistent, high-standard guest experience through strong operational systems and quality control. Alongside SA operations, we run two to three active refurbishment/development projects at any given time, coordinating contractors, procurement, documentation, and stakeholder communication to deliver projects efficiently and to a high standard.



This is a hands-on Operations Lead role responsible for execution across our serviced accommodation portfolio and coordination support across refurbishment/development projects. Your core focus is proactive quality control and consistent delivery: you’ll enforce standards through checklists and evidence, ensure guests have a smooth end-to-end experience, and reduce recurring issues by continuously improving SOPs. In parallel, you’ll support project coordination for refurbishments by running follow-ups with contractors and suppliers, managing documentation, and scheduling appointments to keep workstreams moving without drift.



We’re hiring an Operations Lead who can run a cadence, enforce quality standards, and coordinate delivery across both serviced accommodation and active refurb projects.



Monday- Sunday:10:00-18:00 ( with 1 hour break) UK time, Saturday or Sunday off for one day.

Salary :700 USD Per month+ KPI bonus



Core responsibilities

Serviced Accommodation operations (delivery + standards)

- Enforce unit standards using checklists, photo evidence, and “definition of done” quality bars.

- Manage guest communications: fast responses, professional tone, calm resolution, and proactive updates.

- Maintain an issues/defects log and ensure issues are fully closed with root-cause prevention (not just “ticket closed”).

- Coordinate cleaners and operational VAs: confirm turnovers, verify quality, and drive consistent performance.

- Monitor pricing and availability: check pricing rules are being applied, flag risks/opportunities, and escalate recommendations.

- Create and update listings: listing setup, copy accuracy, amenities, house rules, photo requirements, and platform compliance (
 as applicable).

- Maintain and improve SOPs: update processes based on recurring issues, guest feedback, and operational learnings.

Property project coordination (admin execution)

- Maintain a project tracker for tasks, owners, due dates, and blockers.

- Source and compare quotes: produce a quote comparison table and recommendation.

- Follow-up with contractors, suppliers, utilities, council, other professional, keep reference numbers, paper trail, and next-step ownership.

- Documentation: build/format/update project packs, submissions, and version control.

- Appointment scheduling: inspections, contractor visits, deliveries, surveys, and access coordination.

Reporting directly to company CEO



Tools and working style

- We use Lark for communication, tracking, and internal workflows.

- Google Drive for document storage and document control.

- PMS/pricing tools as applicable (Hostaway/PriceLabs or similar).



Must-have experience

- Evidence-based quality control: Create and used checklists/audits/photo evidence used to enforce standards and reduce recurring issues.

- Serviced accommodation or hospitality ops: guest comms + turnover coordination + issue resolution.

- Property management working experience

- Vendor/contractor coordination: proactive follow-up, scheduling, and timeline control.

- Strong written English: crisp guest messaging and concise leadership updates.

- SOP ownership: has maintained/improved SOPs based on operational reality, not just followed them.

Nice-to-have experience

- Listing creation and optimization (
).

- Pricing/availability monitoring and familiarity with revenue management tools (e.g., PriceLabs).

- Property management operations or refurb coordination admin.

Personality traits we’re looking for

- Conscientious and detail-accurate.

- Proactive follow-up and ownership mindset.

- Structured and process-driven (lives in checklists/trackers).

- Calm, professional, and solution-oriented with guests and vendors.

- Improves systems continuously rather than firefighting repeatedly.

- Well organised with multiple task and able to prioritise



Hiring process:

Step 1: Answer the Google link below (required) and follow the instructions after.

Step 2: Answer scenario based questions

Step 3: Join 20-minute screening call

Step 4: Paid trial task

Step 5: Final interview + references



HOW TO APPLY:



Click the link

I’ll be in touch with you in 3-5 working days.



Please note, we ONLY accept applications through this application process. PLEASE DO NOT use the website’s message board as we don’t monitor this.

title: Local SEO Assistant
description:
Local SEO Partners is a U.S.-based boutique SEO agency that helps contractors, builders, and home service businesses dominate their local markets through strategic local search optimization, high-converting websites, and smart automation. We're looking for a sharp, detail-oriented Local SEO Assistant to manage and optimize client local SEO campaigns as we scale.



What You'll Do



Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



Managing and optimizing Google Business Profiles for contractor and home service businesses

Building and maintaining local citations across directories and platforms

Monitoring local search rankings and making data-driven optimization recommendations

Conducting local keyword research, competitor analysis, and market research

Optimizing on-page SEO elements including title tags, meta descriptions, headers, and content

Managing review monitoring and response coordination for client locations

Performing NAP (Name, Address, Phone) consistency audits and cleanup

Supporting link building and local content optimization efforts

Tracking and reporting local search performance metrics

Coordinating with the team using project management and reporting tools



Required Technical Skills & Experience



To qualify for this position, you will need experience with:



Google Business Profile setup, optimization, and management

Local citation building and management across major platforms

Basic on-page SEO optimization (title tags, meta descriptions, headers, content)

Google Analytics and Google Search Console fundamentals

Local keyword research and competitive analysis

Strong written English with the ability to write clear, optimized content



Soft Skills



We work in a fast-paced agency environment, so it's important that you are:



Analytical and data-driven in your decision-making

Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills

Reliable and consistent with attendance and communication

Comfortable asking questions rather than making assumptions

Eager to learn, test, and continuously improve



Basic Skills



In addition to strong English skills, you should be comfortable using or learning:



Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Drive

Spreadsheet organization for tracking citations, rankings, and projects

 and chat communication tools

Project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Trello, or similar)

AI tools such as ChatGPT and Claude (training provided)



Desired Skills (Not Required)



These aren't mandatory, but will help you grow faster in this role:



Experience with local SEO tools (BrightLocal, Whitespark, Local Falcon, Semrush, etc.)

Basic WordPress familiarity or willingness to learn

Understanding of the contractor or home service industry

Experience with review management platforms

Basic HTML/CSS knowledge

Familiarity with schema markup for local businesses

Experience with GoHighLevel or similar CRM/marketing platforms

Basic design skills and profeciency with Canva



Work Schedule & Holidays



This is a full-time position (40 hours per week). Work schedule will be agreed upon in advance.



You will receive:



6 paid Philippine holidays per year:



New Year's Day

Good Friday

Labor Day

Independence Day

All Saints' Day

Christmas Day



Compensation:



$5.00 USD per hour to start



Automatic increase to $5.25 USD per hour after a 90-day onboarding and calibration period



Weekly pay, paid in USD



Perks & Benefits

While this is an independent contractor role, we prioritize long-term stability and fair treatment:



Weekly, on-time payments

Annual holiday bonus (in place of 13th-month pay)

Clear opportunities for raises and expanded responsibilities over time



How to Apply



When applying, please include the phrase "Local SEO Partners SEO Assistant" in your subject line.



Please also include:



A short introduction about yourself

Your relevant experience with local SEO and Google Business Profile management

Your internet speed and backup setup

Examples of local SEO results you've achieved (ranking improvements, citation work, GBP optimizations - screenshots welcome)

Your availability and preferred working hours

Why you're interested in working with a local SEO agency that focuses on home service businesses



Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be reviewed.

title: Go High Level (GHL) Admin / Implementation Specialist
description:
We’re a Chicago-area real estate brokerage and mortgage lending company helping homebuyers, sellers, and investors across the Chicago Southland and Northwest Indiana. We’re looking for an experienced Go High Level admin to set up, manage, and optimize our GHL system to streamline our lead generation, client communication, and sales processes.

What You’ll Be Doing

• Setting up and managing our Go High Level CRM — contacts, pipelines, tags, and custom fields

• Building and optimizing automation workflows (lead nurture sequences, appointment reminders, follow-up campaigns)

• Creating and managing landing pages and funnels for real estate and mortgage lead generation

• Setting up reputation management — automated review requests, monitoring, and response workflows

• Building SMS and
 campaigns within GHL

• Creating and managing appointment booking calendars

• Setting up triggers, conditions, and actions to automate lead routing and follow-up

• Integrating GHL with other platforms
