title: Amazon Admin VA Seller Support
description:
We are looking for an admin Virtual Assistant to help us file Amazon Seller Support reimbursement cases for our Amazon business. This is a part-time role where your main responsibility is to follow a clearly defined system exactly as instructed.



Your job will be to create PDF documents using images that we provide, use AI tools to reformulate text prompts given to you, and submit reimbursement cases to Amazon Seller Support. All images, exact text prompts, structure, workflow, documentation, and video training are provided. You are only required to follow the steps accurately until the task is completed.



This is a part-time role averaging around 10 hours per week (sometimes more, sometimes less). The starting pay is $3 per hour, with a performance bonus of $1 for each hour in which you successfully file 25 cases. Additional bonuses are available for correctly re-applying rejected cases that later get approved (to be discussed).



Before hiring, we will run a short paid trial. We will select 2–4 applicants who pass all filters and evaluate accuracy, speed, communication, and how well feedback is applied. Only one candidate will be selected for this role.



To ensure you are reading this post, include the following subject line all in lowercase with no capital letters: “admin amazon va” and I would also like for your to give me the answer to this question somewhere in your message: what is your dream travel destination?



At the very end of your message, include your 
 username as well as your
 address so we can schedule a Zoom call.



You will be required to sign up with our Hubstaff timekeeping tracking software.

title: Web Designer for Local SEO Agency
description:
Local SEO Partners is a U.S.-based boutique Local SEO agency that helps contractors, builders, and home service businesses dominate their local markets through strategic local search optimization, high-converting websites, and smart automation. We're looking for a creative, detail-oriented Part-Time Web Designer to create compelling graphics and website designs for our local service business clients.



What You'll Do



Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



Designing modern, conversion-focused website mockups and landing pages for contractors and home service businesses

Creating graphics for websites, social media, and marketing materials

Designing hero sections, service page layouts, and other website components

Creating branded visual assets including logos, icons, and illustrations

Designing Google Business Profile graphics and cover photos

Collaborating with our developer to ensure designs are implemented correctly

Following brand guidelines and creating cohesive visual identities for clients

Reviewing competitor websites and creating designs that help clients stand out

Creating before/after mockups and design presentations for client approval

Working within our design system and style guides



Required Technical Skills & Experience



To qualify for this position, you will need experience with:



Figma (this is our primary design tool - must be proficient)

Modern web design principles and best practices

Creating responsive designs for mobile and desktop

Typography, color theory, and layout fundamentals

Understanding of conversion-focused design (CTAs, user flow, etc.)

Strong written English for communicating design decisions



Soft Skills



We work in a fast-paced agency environment, so it's important that you are:



Creative with a strong eye for aesthetics and detail

Able to understand and design for blue-collar industries (not just tech/SaaS)

Reliable and consistent with attendance and communication

Comfortable receiving and implementing feedback

Able to balance creativity with business goals and conversion focus

Eager to learn and adapt your style to different clients



Basic Skills

In addition to strong English skills, you should be comfortable using or learning:



Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Drive

File organization and version control for design files

 and chat communication tools (Slack, ClickUp, etc.)

Screen recording tools for presenting designs

AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, and Midjourney (training provided)



Desired Skills (Not Required)



These aren't mandatory, but will help you grow faster in this role:



Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator)

Canva proficiency for quick graphics

Basic understanding of WordPress or website builders

Experience designing for local service businesses (contractors, plumbers, HVAC, remodelers, etc.)

Photography editing and image optimization

Basic HTML/CSS knowledge (reading, not writing)

Experience with Oxygen Builder, Elementor, or similar page builders

Understanding of accessibility and SEO-friendly design principles



Work Schedule & Holidays



This is a part-time position (20 hours per week). Work schedule will be agreed upon in advance.

You will receive:



3 paid Philippine holidays per year (proportional to part-time hours):



New Year's Day

Independence Day

Christmas Day



Compensation



$5.00 USD per hour to start

Automatic increase to $5.25 USD per hour after a 90-day onboarding and calibration period

Weekly pay, paid in USD



Perks & Benefits

While this is an independent contractor role, we prioritize long-term stability and fair treatment:



Weekly, on-time payments

Annual holiday bonus (in place of 13th-month pay, prorated for part-time)

Clear opportunities for raises and potential expansion to full-time

Work with real clients and build a strong portfolio



How to Apply



When applying, please include the phrase "Local SEO Partners Web Designer" in your subject line.



Please also include:



A short introduction about yourself

Your design experience - what types of websites/businesses have you designed for?

Your Figma experience level (1-10 scale and how long you've used it)

Portfolio link or PDF - Must include at least 3 website design examples (mockups or live sites you designed)

Your internet speed and backup setup

Your availability and preferred working hours (which 20 hours per week work best for you)

Why you're interested in designing for contractor and home service businesses



IMPORTANT: Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed. We need to see examples of your website design work.



What Makes a Great Portfolio for This Role



We're looking for designs that show:



Clean, modern layouts that work for blue-collar industries (not overly corporate or tech-focused)

Strong use of imagery and visual hierarchy

Clear calls-to-action and conversion focus

Mobile-responsive thinking

Professional polish and attention to detail



Bonus points if you have examples of:



Contractor, remodeler, or home service business designs

Before/after website redesigns

Landing page designs

Service business branding



Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be reviewed.

title: Senior Social Media Manager & Growth Operator
description:
Job Title: Senior Social Media Manager (Experienced Only)



This is not a beginner role and not a VA position.



I’m building a personal brand focused on pressure, performance, and execution, and I’m looking for an experienced Social Media Manager who can fully manage, optimise, and scale all social media accounts end-to-end.



You will be responsible for strategy, daily execution, growth, and performance across all platforms. This role requires someone who already understands how social media accounts grow and how to manage them properly at scale.



If you are still learning or need step-by-step guidance, this role is not for you.



Responsibilities

Social Media Account Management



You will fully manage and operate all social media platforms, including:



Instagram



TikTok



YouTube



YouTube Shorts



X 
)



LinkedIn



Podcast platforms (Spotify, Apple Podcasts, etc.)



This includes posting, scheduling, optimisation, monitoring performance, and maintaining account health.



Platform Strategy & Growth



You are expected to understand how each platform works and how accounts scale over time.



This includes:



Developing platform-specific strategies



Optimising posting frequency and timing



Understanding when content should drive reach, authority, or long-term growth



Adjusting strategy based on performance and platform changes



You should be able to explain why something works, not just that it does.



SEO & Discoverability (Required)



Strong SEO knowledge is required for this role, especially:



YouTube SEO (titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails, retention)



Podcast optimisation and discoverability



Keyword-based captions and descriptions



Long-term, search-driven content planning



This brand should grow through both algorithms and search, not just viral content.



AI & Automation (Required)



You must already be using AI tools in your workflow.



This includes using AI for:



Content planning and ideation



Caption writing and optimisation



SEO support



Workflow automation



Performance analysis



AI should be used to improve speed, quality, and consistency. If you are not already using AI daily in your work, this role is not a fit.



Content Oversight



You will oversee how content is distributed across platforms, including:



Long-form podcast distribution



Short-form content adapted for each platform



Quality control and consistency of messaging



Ensuring content aligns with the brand positioning



If content is weak or off-brand, you are expected to flag it and correct it.



Analytics & Reporting



You will track and analyse performance across platforms, including:



Identifying what content performs best and why



Monitoring growth trends



Making data-driven adjustments



Reporting insights clearly and regularly



This role requires someone comfortable making decisions based on data.



Requirements (No Exceptions)



Proven experience managing and scaling social media accounts



Experience managing multiple platforms at the same time



Strong understanding of social media algorithms



Strong SEO knowledge (especially YouTube and podcasts)



Regular use of AI tools in daily workflows



Ability to work independently and take ownership



Strong written English



This Role Is Not For You If



You are a beginner or still learning social media



You only know how to post content



You do not understand SEO



You are not using AI tools in your work



You need constant instructions or supervision



How to Apply



Please include:



Social media accounts you have managed or grown (links)



Platforms you are strongest on



Results you have achieved (numbers preferred)



AI tools you use and how you use them



A short explanation of how you d
 what to post on each platform



Applications without examples will not be considered.

title: SENIOR FOUNDER GTM & DEAL FLOW OPERATOR -B2B | Diagnostics, Strategy & Follow-On Engagements Remote | Full-Time | Long-T
description:
READ THIS FIRST (IMPORTANT)



This is a senior, autonomous role.



If you need daily coaching, scripts, reassurance, or constant access to the Founder, do not apply.



After a short onboarding period, you will be expected to independently take the Founder to market, represent them professionally, and keep their calendar filled without day-to-day management.



This role is for someone who already knows exactly what they are doing and wants a long-term position with upside.



THE MISSION (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



Your responsibility is simple and absolute:



Independently take the Founder to market and consistently book 15–20 qualified B2B companies per month into high-value, paid diagnostic sessions — with minimal Founder involvement.



That is 3–5 qualified bookings per week, every week.

Booked. Qualified. Attended. Paid.



AUTONOMY EXPECTATION



Once trained and aligned, you will:



Decide how to execute outreach



Choose the best channels (cold calls, LinkedIn,
, etc.)



Run daily activity without oversight



Optimise messaging and systems independently



Solve problems without escalation



You will not be micromanaged.

You will not be spoon-fed.

You will represent the Founder in the market.



If you need constant direction, this role is not for you.



WHAT YOU OWN (END-TO-END)

???? Founder Positioning & Representation



You will:



Deeply understand the Founder’s thinking, tone, and diagnostic approach



Represent the Founder confidently and professionally



Speak to decision-makers as a direct extension of the Founder



Maintain authority, clarity, and credibility in every interaction



You are the front line of the Founder’s brand.



???? Offer Packaging (Diagnostics + Follow-On Offers)



You will:



Clearly position the diagnostic sessions



Understand and introduce follow-on offers where appropriate



Move companies from interest ? diagnostic ? next step



Ensure only serious companies reach the Founder



This is not booking for booking’s sake.



???? Outbound Demand Creation (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



You will independently:



Cold call senior decision-makers



Run LinkedIn outreach and conversations



Use
 where appropriate



Follow up relentlessly



Adapt messaging based on results



You do whatever works — not what’s comfortable.



???? Qualification & Calendar Ownership



You fully own:



Qualification standards



Booking decisions



Calendar quality



Show-up rates



If unqualified or low-quality calls reach the calendar, that is on you.



???? AI, AUTOMATION & EFFICIENCY (CORE REQUIREMENT)



You are expected to:



Use AI and automation tools daily



Constantly look for ways to improve efficiency



Reduce manual work while increasing results



Experiment, refine, and optimise systems



You should naturally think:



“How do I get better results in less time?”



You must be AI-literate, creative, and excited by optimisation.



NON-NEGOTIABLE REQUIREMENTS

???? Advanced, Proven Experience (MANDATORY)



You must have already done this in a previous role.



Experience must include:



Taking founders, consultants, or expert-led offers to market



Booking consistent, high-quality B2B appointments



Operating independently without supervision



Representing senior figures professionally



If you are “ready to step up” but haven’t done this before, do not apply.



????? Fluent, Clear, Professional English



Confident spoken and written English



Comfortable speaking with Founders, Directors, and senior leaders



Able to communicate authority and clarity



This will be tested live.



?? High Phone Confidence



Comfortable cold calling daily



Emotionally neutral to rejection



Able to lead and control conversations



Phones are part of the job. No exceptions.



???? AI-Savvy & Automation-Minded



Familiar with modern AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)



Comfortable experimenting with tools and workflows



Focused on leverage, not busywork



COMPENSATION & GROWTH (OPTION 4 – PERFORMANCE-DRIVEN)



This role is designed for confident operators who want upside, autonomy, and long-term growth.



PHASE 1: PROOF PHASE (FIRST 60 DAYS)



Base: $600 per month



Bonus: $75 per qualified, completed, and paid diagnostic booking



Expectation: 12–15 qualified bookings per month minimum



Failure to hit this consistently = role ends.



PHASE 2: SCALE & OWNERSHIP PHASE



After consistent performance is proven:



Base: $1,200 per month



Bonus: $50 per qualified, completed, and paid diagnostic booking



Target: 15–20 qualified bookings per month



Additional performance incentives available for top performers



No ceiling for strong performance.



What Counts as a Booking



A booking only counts if ALL are true:



Decision-maker



Meets agreed company criteria



Diagnostic is attended



Diagnostic is paid



No-shows, unpaid, or unqualified bookings do not count.



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



? Not a VA

? Not a junior SDR

? Not marketing or social media

? Not lead scraping

? Not short-term

? Not micromanaged



This is a senior, autonomous, long-term role.



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, you must include:



1?? Proof of previous roles where you independently booked B2B appointments

2?? Examples of monthly booking results you’ve achieved

3?? How you use AI or automation to improve efficiency

4?? Confirmation that you are comfortable operating without daily oversight



Generic or vague applications will be ignored.



FINAL WORD



This role exists so the Founder does not need to be involved in booking activity.



If you are:



experienced



autonomous



commercially sharp



confident representing a Founder



excited by AI and optimisation



This is a rare, high-trust, long-term opportunity.

title: REMOTE OPERATIONS & AI ENABLEMENT MANAGER  Direct Sales Business | Full-Time | Remote (Philippines Preferred)
description:
READ THIS CAREFULLY



This is not a basic VA role.



If you are entry-level, uncomfortable on the phone, slow with technology, or need step-by-step instructions, do not apply.



We are hiring a high-calibre remote operator to help run the daily operations of a fast-moving direct sales company. This role combines recruitment, sales reporting, administration, people management, and AI-driven process optimisation.



You will work directly with the Founder and shareholders and will be trusted with real responsibility.



WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Calling candidates daily (high volume)



Screening, qualifying, and booking interviews



Relentless follow-up with applicants



Managing recruitment pipelines and trackers



Placing candidates into roles and updating status daily



This role is phone-heavy. If you do not enjoy speaking to people, this role is not for you.

Collecting daily sales numbers from sales representatives



Producing clear, structured daily reports



Sharing updates with:



Founder



Supplier



Shareholders



Flagging issues early (non-reporting reps, low activity, drop-offs)



This requires discipline, logic, and attention to detail.



???? Administration & Internal Communication



Acting as the central communication hub for the business



Managing inboxes and internal messages



Being the main point of contact between:



Management ? Sales reps



Management ? Suppliers



Chasing responses and keeping people accountable



You are the filter and organiser, not a passive assistant.



???? AI Enablement & Process Optimisation



You will help evolve the business into a more automated, streamlined, and AI-driven operation.



This includes:



Identifying inefficiencies and repetitive tasks



Using AI tools to simplify workflows



Automating reporting, recruitment, and admin processes



Creating SOPs and internal systems using AI



We want applied AI in real business operations, not theory.



NON-NEGOTIABLE REQUIREMENTS

???? High-Level Computer Skills



You must be an advanced computer user.



This means:



Extremely comfortable using multiple softwares, platforms, and apps



Able to learn new tools quickly without hand-holding



Confident using CRMs, dashboards, ATS systems, and communication tools



Able to troubleshoot basic technical issues independently



If technology overwhelms you, do not apply.



????? Fluent & Clear English (Critical)



You must have fluent, clear, professional English, both spoken and written.



This role requires:



Daily phone calls with candidates and sales reps



Clear written communication with management, suppliers, and shareholders



Confident, natural conversation (not scripted or robotic)



If your English is not strong enough for real-time phone conversations, do not apply.

Spoken English will be tested during the interview process.



?? People Person & Phone Confidence



You must:



Enjoy speaking to people



Be confident on the phone every day



Handle rejection without emotion



Lead conversations with warmth and authority



Be assertive but respectful



Shy, passive, or low-confidence personalities will not succeed in this role.



???? AI & Automation Mindset



You should naturally ask:



“How can this be done faster, cleaner, or automatically?”



Required familiarity:



ChatGPT / Claude (advanced usage)



Canva (including AI features)



Google Workspace



Bonus (strong advantage):



Zapier / Make



Notion AI



CRM automation



AI-powered recruitment tools



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



? Organised and structured

? Calm under pressure

? Confident communicator

? Proactive problem-solver

? Comfortable taking ownership

? Enjoys being at the centre of operations



WHO THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR



? Entry-level VAs

? People uncomfortable on the phone

? Passive “tell me what to do” personalities

? AI buzzword users with no real application

? Anyone looking for an easy role



COMPENSATION



???? $800–$1,200 per month (full-time)

Higher for exceptional candidates with strong operations + AI experience.



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, you must include:



1?? A real example of how you used AI to improve or automate a business process

2?? A list of softwares and tools you use confidently on a daily basis

3?? Your experience in phone-heavy roles (recruitment, sales, or operations)



Applications without clear, specific answers will be ignored.



FINAL NOTE



This role carries real responsibility.



If you perform well, you will:



Become indispensable



Grow with the company



Be trusted with authority



If you underperform, we will know quickly.

title: Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager
description:
Experience: 5–10+ years (judgment matters more than tenure)

 Reports to: Head of Accounting



This Is Not a Typical Accounting Role

Monterra is not a bookkeeping firm.

 We work with multi-location operators and founders who rely on their numbers to make real decisions.

This role is for someone who:

Notices when numbers don’t make sense

Pushes back on bad data or bad assumptions

Takes responsibility for accuracy and clarity

Is comfortable being accountable for outcomes, not just tasks





If you are looking for a role where you “prepare and escalate,” this will not be a fit.



What You Will Actually Be Responsible For

You will own the quality of accounting output for a portfolio of US-based clients.



That includes:

Reviewing monthly financials for internal consistency and accuracy

Identifying misclassifications, timing issues, and missing accruals

Flagging issues before they reach senior review

Explaining variances and trends in plain English

Pushing back on incomplete or incorrect client inputs

Enforcing scope, process, and deadlines

Working independently without constant direction





You are expected to think like a controller, even if the title is Senior Accountant.



What “Senior” Means Here

In this role, “senior” does not mean:

Years of experience alone or Knowing every rule by memory





It does mean:

You sanity-check your own work

You notice when results don’t align with reality

You raise issues even when it’s uncomfortable

You can explain why something matters, not just what happened







What Your Day to Day Will Look Like

Oversee, communicate & be responsible for a group of our clients to ensure that they are well-serviced from A-Z and that they are kept satisfied

Prepare & complete year-end financial statements and present them to our clients

Assist in onboarding new clients by helping to clean up messy books

Review the day-to-day work performed by others to ensure that everything is on track

Be accountable for the quality and timeliness of all tasks related to group of clients that are assigned to you

Assist with some of our virtual CFO services, such as budgeting, cash flow projections, KPI reports, consolidations and other miscellaneous management reports that may be required by our clients

Assist with bookkeeping & sales tax related tasks







Required Background

You should have most of the following:

5+ years in accounting, audit, or controllership roles

Experience reviewing others’ work (formally or informally)

Strong understanding of accrual accounting and financial statements

Exposure to multi-entity or operational businesses

Comfort working with US-based clients and teams

Excellent written English (clear, direct, professional)

CPA or similar designation very helpful but not required

You believe in delivering awesome customer service and you have experience in a customer-facing role

You are a problem solver

You have experience creating budgets, cash-flow projections and consolidations



Audit, accounting manager, or shared services leadership backgrounds are a strong plus.



What Will Disqualify You

Please do not apply if:

You primarily “follow instructions” rather than question them

You wait to be told when something looks wrong

You are uncomfortable pushing back on clients or colleagues

You rely on escalation instead of judgment

You are looking for a training or junior role





This is an accountability role.



Compensation (Read Carefully)

USD $3,500–$4,500 per month, paid bi-weekly, DOE

15-20 Days PTO, Unlimited Flex Time, 2 Days Volunteer Time



This role is designed for someone who wants:



Stability

Clear expectations

Real responsibility

Long-term growth as the firm scales





We are not optimizing for the lowest-cost hire.

We are optimizing for judgment, reliability, and reduced rework.



How You’ll Be Evaluated

In your first 90 days, success looks like:

Fewer issues reaching senior review

Clear written explanations accompanying your work

Problems identified early, not after the fact

Increased confidence from US reviewers in your output

Reduced rework and back-and-forth





Speed matters — but accuracy and judgment matter more.



Why This Role Exists

We are intentionally building a global accounting team where:

Judgment is not centralized in the US

Senior offshore talent has real responsibility

Good decisions are rewarded, not punished





This role is a stepping stone to broader ownership as the firm scales.





Why Work With Us?

Most accounting roles are designed to make you smaller.

You prepare.

 You escalate.

 You wait.

 Someone else thinks.

That is not what we are building.

Monterra is building a next-generation accounting and advisory firm where:

Judgment matters more than hierarchy

Good decisions are valued more than perfect checklists

Senior accountants are trusted to think, not just execute





We work with multi-location operators and founders who rely on their numbers to make real decisions. That means the work is complex, sometimes messy, and always meaningful.

If you enjoy being challenged—and want your work to actually matter—this will feel very different from a traditional firm.

Performance-Driven Growth (Not Politics)

Progression here is based on:

Quality of judgment

Reduction in rework

Ability to think independently

Clear communication





Not:

Tenure

Loudness

Internal maneuvering





Strong performers get:

Expanded scope

Higher-value clients

Leadership responsibility

Compensation growth tied to real contribution





If you’re ambitious and capable, you will not be stuck waiting.

Practical, Adult Benefits

We keep perks practical, not gimmicky.



You can expect:

Paid time off (15–20 days)

Paid volunteer days

Paid flex time

Local public holidays respected

Tech stipend

Equipment support if needed

Stable, long-term role (not contract churn)



For senior performers:

Performance-based bonuses

Expanded flexibility

Leadership opportunities as the firm scales



We are not trying to build the biggest accounting firm.

We are building a serious firm—with serious standards—where senior professionals can do the best work of their careers without the bloat, politics, or ceiling that usually comes with it.



If that excites you, we want to hear from you.

If not, that’s okay.

This role is not for everyone—by design.





If you want:

Maximum pay for minimum responsibility ? this is not it

A quiet role where no one notices you ? not a fit

Endless instructions and checklists ? look elsewhere





If you want:

To be trusted

To grow quickly

To work with people who take the work seriously

To build a modern firm instead of inheriting a broken one





This is one of the best seats you can get in the market.





How to Apply (Important)

To apply, complete the application at: 
 



Final Note

We are selective by design.

 If this role feels demanding, that’s intentional.

For the right person, this is a chance to do real accounting work — with real ownership — without US firm politics or bloat.

title: Ecommerce Finance & Reporting Analyst (Dropshipping – Part-Time)
description:
We operate a fast-growing ecommerce dropshipping business across multiple stores and markets.



As we scale, our financial setup has become more complex: multiple stores, ad spend, suppliers, payment processors, holds, and timing differences between revenue and cash.



We are looking for a Finance & Reporting Analyst to help us keep our finances clear, structured, and under control.



This is a part-time, long-term role focused on financial reporting, P&L tracking, and cash visibility.



ABOUT THE ROLE



Your role is to give us a clear and reliable view of the financial situation of the business.



You will be responsible for:

- Preparing monthly P&L reports (per store and consolidated)

- Daily / weekly reporting:

  - revenue per store

  - ad spend

  - supplier invoices

  - payment processor balances

- Tracking cash across:

  - payment processors (available balance, holds)

  - bank accounts

  - ad credits

- Improving and maintaining Google Sheets and financial templates

- Ensuring numbers are consistent, accurate, and easy to read

- Flagging inconsistencies, risks, or unusual movements when you see them



This role is about structure, clarity, and financial discipline.



REQUIREMENTS



- Experience with ecommerce or dropshipping finances

- Comfortable working with Google Sheets / Excel

- Familiar with ad spend, suppliers, and payment processors

- Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

- Able to work independently and communicate clearly



WHAT WE OFFER



- Part-time role (around 10 hours/week)

- Hourly rate: 6–8 USD/hour (based on experience)

- Long-term collaboration

- Flexible working hours

- Direct communication with founders

- Clear scope and expectations



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, please follow these steps:



1) Change your application subject to:

Let’s work together M



2) Send your CV



3) Send a Loom video (3–4 minutes) answering:

- What financial reports did you handle in your previous ecommerce or dropshipping role?

- How do you usually track ad spend, supplier costs, and payment processor balances?



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: High-Performance Video Editor VA (Views & Virality Focus)
description:
High-Performance Video Editor VA (Views & Virality Focus)

Position: Virtual Assistant – Video Editor

Type: Full-time / Part-time (Remote)



About the Role:

We are hiring a high-output, performance-driven Video Editor VA whose main objective is to maximize views, retention, and engagement across short-form platforms.



This role is ideal for editors who want their compensation tied to performance, not just hours worked.



Core Responsibilities

-Edit 3 performance-optimized videos per day using Adobe Premiere Pro



-Engineer strong hooks within the first 1–3 seconds



-Optimize pacing, captions, b-roll, sound effects, and music to increase retention



-Edit for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



-Attend a daily strategy check-in with the Project Manager



-Iterate based on performance data and feedback



???? Performance Bonus Structure (Views-Based)

Bonuses are paid monthly based on total views generated by your edits.



Per Video Bonus Tiers (within 30 days of posting):



25,000+ views ? +$10



50,000+ views ? +$25



100,000+ views ? +$50



250,000+ views ? +$100



500,000+ views ? +$250



1,000,000+ views ? Custom bonus + priority pay increase



Requirements

2+ years professional video editing experience



Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro



Fluent English (spoken and written)



Strong understanding of short-form content performance



Reliable internet and editing workstation



???? Test Project (Required to Apply)

To move forward in the hiring process, applicants must complete a short, unpaid test project designed to assess editing skill, pacing, and understanding of virality.



Test Project Details:



You will be provided with raw video footage



Edit 1 short-form video (30–60 seconds)



Focus on hook, pacing, captions, and retention



Time limit: 2–3 hours max



No spec work beyond this single test clip



What We Evaluate:



Strength of the opening hook



Editing rhythm and pacing



Caption clarity and placement



Creative choices that increase watch time



Ability to follow instructions



Only shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete the test project.



To Apply

Please submit:



Your video editing portfolio (include view counts if available)



A short explanation of how you approach creating viral content



Your availability and timezone



Growth Opportunity

Editors who consistently deliver high-performing content can grow into:



Higher base pay



Larger performance bonuses



Lead Editor / Creative Strategist roles



If you want next, I can:



Write the exact test-project instructions you send to candidates



Create a scoring rubric so your PM can evaluate fast



Design a 14-day paid trial structure



Build this into a Google Form / Notion hiring pipeline



This hiring setup will pull in serious editors only.

title: Pro  Video Editor/Director - Expert Only~!
description:
PRO LEVEL EDITOR / Director - Creative Operations Manager

ProfitEngines – Media & Marketing Solutions Partner













**Summary Version**

We are looking for a PRO EDITOR / DIRECTOR  to serve as both a editor and a guide for client video strategies. In this role, you will work directly with the CEO to shape client content direction, oversee video production. You should have experience guiding video production at a strategic level, helping clients refine ideas, improve storytelling, and create content that drives engagement and conversions. This is not JUST AN editing role, but one that requires leadership in process flow, creativity.



The right candidate understands how video ties overall marketing campaigns. You will quarterback the process from raw content that we receive to ideation to deliverable, ensuring clients stay accountable, projects move forward, and final content aligns with both creative vision and CLIENT goals. 



If you thrive where creativity meets leadership, this is the role for you.



---



**Full Job Post**



We are seeking a EXPERT VIDEO EDITOR who brings leadership, vision, and process together. This is not a behind-the-scenes role. This is about stepping forward as a creative leader who helps clients think bigger about their video strategies, guides them through process, and directs them toward content that drives both viewership and conversions.



You will work directly with the CEO AND OUR Video editing team, serving as his partner in shaping not only client strategies but also his own video direction. You will be the liaison between leadership, clients, and our production teams, ensuring that communication is clear, ideas are inspired, and projects move forward without delays. The single most important outcome is making sure clients get the guidance they need to produce high-quality video content consistently.



A major focus of this role is acting as a director for client video. You are not an editor, but you know how to inspire and guide the people who are on camera. You understand how to help clients model their content, refine their ideas, and create video that aligns with their brand voice and audience goals. You bring a producer’s mindset to process flow and a strategist’s eye to creativity. You can suggest higher-level thinking, new approaches, and practical strategies that increase engagement, adoption, and conversion through video.



The right candidate has experience in a digital agency or creative environment and knows the world of marketing beyond video.. You should be able to speak the language of digital marketing while bringing the leadership presence of someone who can sit with a client and direct them toward the right creative path.



Strong organizational skills are still essential, beyond keeping the process moving, you will lead the creative conversation and ensure every client feels they are in the hands of someone who not only edits like a pro but also inspires.



At ProfitEngines, we deliver solutions that range from social media management and video production to AI-driven campaigns, SEO, and paid advertising. We are growing quickly, and this role sits at the center of that growth. If you thrive at the intersection of creative leadership and operational excellence, and if you love helping clients unlock their best ideas while keeping the process streamlined, we want to hear from you.

title: Senior Accounting Manager
description:
?Role Overview

?We are seeking a Senior Accounting Manager to lead and orchestrate the financial operations of a large-scale, global enterprise. This is not a "hands-on" role for a generalist; it is a strategic leadership position requiring a candidate who has mastered the complexities of high-volume transactions and multi-national entity management.

?The successful candidate will oversee a sophisticated accounting department, providing high-level coordination across specialized functions including AP, AR, Cost Accounting, and FP&A. You will be responsible for the integrity of the group’s financial health, specifically focusing on the consolidation of multiple overseas sub-entities and ensuring seamless financial reporting at scale.

?Key Responsibilities

?1. Strategic Leadership & Team Management

?-Directly manage and mentor a team of functional managers (AP Manager, AR Manager, Cost Manager, and FP&A Manager).

-?Standardize accounting workflows across departments to ensure maximum efficiency and accuracy.

?-Act as the primary bridge between technical accounting and strategic financial planning.

?2. Global Consolidation & Reporting

-?Lead the month-end and year-end closing process for the parent company and 3+ international sub-entities.

?-Prepare and review Consolidated Financial Statements in accordance with IFRS/GAAP, ensuring all intercompany eliminations and foreign currency translations are flawlessly executed.

?-Oversee global audit coordination and ensure compliance with international statutory requirements.

?3. Operational Excellence & Oversight

?-Supervise the Cost Management function to ensure manufacturing/operational costs are optimized and accurately reflected.

?-Collaborate with the FP&A Manager to align historical accounting data with forward-looking budgets and forecasts.

?-Ensure the AR and AP functions are operating at scale, maintaining healthy cash flow and vendor/client relationships.

?4. Systems & Internal Controls

?-Maintain and improve internal control frameworks (SOX or equivalent) within a large-scale ERP environment (SAP, Oracle, etc.).

?-Drive continuous process improvement to handle increasing transaction volumes and organizational complexity.



?Qualifications & Requirements

?Experience: Minimum of 10+ years of progressive accounting experience, with at least 3 years in a Senior Management role within a large corporate environment or a Big 4 accounting firm.

?Scale Mastery: Proven track record of managing accounting for organizations with significant revenue and complex departmental structures. Experience in small-to-mid-sized firms alone will not be sufficient for this role.

?Technical Expertise: Expert-level knowledge of Consolidated Financial Statements and multi-currency reporting.

?Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA or CMA certification is highly preferred.

?Systems: Advanced proficiency in Tier-1 ERP systems (SAP S/4HANA, Oracle EBS) and consolidation software.

?Leadership: Demonstrated ability to manage other managers and influence stakeholders at the executive level.

title: Credit Repair Customer Service Agent
description:
PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH A CREDIT REPAIR COMPANY.



Position: Customer Service Representative (Credit Repair Experience Required)

Starting Pay: $525 USD



Thank you for your interest in joining our team at Credit Miracles!



We are currently seeking a reliable, experienced, and highly motivated Customer Service Representative to join our fast-paced credit repair team. This position is fully remote and requires a minimum of one year of customer service experience within a credit repair company. Candidates without this specific experience will not be considered.



This role is client-facing and critical to the success of our business. As a Customer Service Representative, you will serve as the first point of contact for our clients, helping them stay informed, supported, and confident throughout their credit repair journey. You will communicate via
, phone, chat, and social media and be expected to uphold our company’s five-star service standards at all times.



Minimum Requirements to Be Successful in This Role:

 • At least 1 year of experience working in customer service within the credit repair industry (required)

 • Reliable internet connection and quiet, professional work environment

 • Strong knowledge of credit repair processes, dispute timelines, credit monitoring, and client expectations

 • Experience using credit repair CRMs such as DisputeFox or Credit Repair Cloud

 • Proficiency in Gmail, Google Docs, Zoom, and client management systems

 • Must be self-motivated, dependable, and able to follow instructions without constant supervision

 • Strong communication skills (spoken and written)

 • Ability to handle multiple clients and cases while staying organized and meeting deadlines

 • Must be comfortable handling difficult client situations with empathy and professionalism

 • Ability to learn and adapt to evolving procedures and systems



Job Responsibilities:

 • Deliver exceptional client support via phone,
, chat, and social media

 • Monitor client accounts and credit reports using internal systems and credit monitoring platforms

 • Respond promptly to client inquiries, billing questions, and credit concerns

 • Provide accurate, clear, and friendly communication

 • Log all interactions and updates within our CRM system in real-time

 • Send and follow up on onboarding documents, payment issues, credit monitoring access, and more

 • Educate clients about basic credit building tools, their responsibilities, and our process

 • Flag and escalate complex cases to senior tea
mbers as needed

 • Ensure clients remain engaged, compliant, and supported throughout their program

 • Follow company policies, maintain client confidentiality, and remain TSR and FCRA compliant



Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required):

 • Experience in billing or payment resolution

 • Familiarity with dispute flows and credit education

 • Bilingual in Spanish and English



This is a remote position, and the schedule may change at any given time due to business needs. Also reliability and responsiveness during work hours are essential.



If you are passionate about helping others, have real experience in credit repair, and are ready to grow with a high-performing team, we’d love to hear from you.



Apply now and help us change lives through credit restoration

title: Customer Service Support
description:
Clean Seal Australia is a growing trades business based in Melbourne. We currently receive 30+ new

 and phone

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

lbourne Australia time

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE (BUT NOT ESSENTIAL)



?
 Messenger / Meta Business Suite

WHAT WE OFFER:

HOW TO APPLY:

title: Social Media Manager (Community-Focused, Board Game Brand)
description:
We’re building a tabletop card game brand and are looking for a Social Media Manager to help grow our online presence in an authentic, community-driven way.



This is not just a “posting graphics” role. We want someone who understands how to engage with people, join conversations, and help a brand grow from an early stage.



What you’ll be doing:

- Creating, scheduling, and managing social media content

- Engaging with relevant pages, creators, and communities (commenting, replying, joining discussions)

- Helping grow our accounts organically through consistent interaction

- Researching competitors and similar brands to spot trends and content ideas

- Contributing creative ideas for posts, reels, short-form videos, and captions

- Tracking basic performance (what works, what doesn’t, and why)



* Writing newsletters, blogs and
 marketing



Platforms we care about:

- Instagram

- TikTok

- Reddit

- Youtube



What we’re looking for:

- Proven experience managing social media accounts (personal or client work is fine)

- Examples of accounts you’ve worked on and results you’ve helped achieve

- Strong written English and a natural, human tone (No Ai generated content)

- Someone comfortable engaging publicly on behalf of a brand

- Bonus if you enjoy or understand board games, card games, or gaming culture



Nice to have (not required):

- Experience growing early-stage or zero-to-one accounts

- Basic understanding of content analytics

- Interest in community-led brands rather than influencer-led marketing



If you’re someone who enjoys building communities, being creative, and growing brands organically, we’d love to hear from you.



** IN YOUR RESPONSE, PLEASE INCLUDE WHAT YOU WOULD DO TO HELP GROW THE BUSINESS ON SOCIAL MEDIA, HOW YOU WOULD MAKE A DIFFERENCE AND WHAT SKILLS YOU BRING TO THE TABLE (as well as your portfolio) **

title: Personal Assistant (High-Level, Fast-Paced Environment)
description:
About the Role



I’m seeking a sharp, dependable Personal Assistant who can manage details, anticipate needs, and keep both personal and business life running smoothly without constant direction.



This is not an entry-level role.

This is not a passive support position.

This is a role for someone who takes ownership and treats the responsibilities as if they were their own.



You’ll be supporting a real estate investor, entrepreneur, and parent managing multiple businesses, properties, legal matters, finances, and family logistics.



Core Responsibilities



Manage calendar, scheduling, reminders, and time blocks



Schedule and manage doctor, dentist, medical, and personal appointments for the household



Track appointments, prep questions, confirm attendance, and handle follow-ups



Bill pay and expense tracking (personal and business): utilities, subscriptions, insurance, medical bills, vendors, and recurring payments



Monitor due dates, prevent late fees, and flag irregular charges



Handle
s, messages, and follow-ups so nothing falls through the cracks



Organize files, folders, contracts, medical records, and financial documents (Google Drive)



Coordinate Zoo
etings, calls, links, agendas, and notes



Assist with real estate admin tasks (documents, timelines, coordination)



Maintain master to-do lists and priority dashboards



Proactively identify problems, deadlines, or risks before they escalate



Act as a gatekeeper to protect time, focus, and energy



Required Skills



Excellent written and spoken English



High attention to detail and accuracy (especially with money and appointments)



Strong organizational and task-management skills



Comfortable with Google Workspace, Zoom, and basic financial tools



Ability to handle confidential, medical, and financial information discreetly



Calm, solution-oriented, and reliable under pressure



Nice-to-Have (Strong Plus)



Prior Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant experience



Experience handling bill pay or expense management



Real estate, legal, or operations background



Experience supporting entrepreneurs or executives



Familiarity with CRMs, task managers, or SOP-driven environments



Non-Negotiables



You show up on time and communicate clearly



You double-check details, especially payments and appointments



You don’t miss deadlines



You take ownership and follow through



You ask questions early instead of fixing mistakes later



How to Apply



Submit:



A short paragraph explaining why you’re a strong fit



Your resume or work history



A 2–3 minute video answering:



Your experience managing schedules and bill pay



How you prevent mistakes with money or appointments



A situation where you caught an issue before it became a problem

title: GENEALOGIST / PRIVATE INVESTIGATOR
description:
???? GENEALOGIST / PRIVATE INVESTIGATOR



(REMOTE – U.S. RECORDS FOCUS) Part time or Full Time 



THIS IS NOT A BEGINNER ROLE. DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ONLY BUILD FAMILY TREES FOR FUN.



We are hiring an experienced Genealogist / Skip-Tracing Investigator to locate hard-to-find individuals for real estate, probate, heirs, and missing owners.



This role exists to find people others can’t — legally, ethically, and accurately.



???? ROLE SUMMARY



You will research, trace, and locate individuals using genealogy records, public records, and investigative tools.

Obituaries



Property & tax records



Court filings

Phone numbers



s

Deliver clean, court-ready reports



Escalate dead ends with next-step recommendations



? REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



You must have:



3+ years experience in:



Genealogy research OR



Private investigation / skip tracing



Strong experience with U.S. public records



Proven ability to:



Track people across states



Resolve name changes, aliases, remarriages



Identify correct individuals with similar names



Excellent written English



Extreme attention to detail



Comfort working independently



???? REQUIRED TOOLS EXPERIENCE



You must be proficient in AT LEAST SOME of the following:











MyHeritage







Whitepages / Spokeo / BeenVerified

? STRONG ADVANTAGE IF YOU HAVE

???? COMPENSATION

 later):

$6–$10/hour (based on experience)



Option B – Per Case



Fixed rate per completed locate



Bonuses for difficult / cold cases



Long-term, consistent work for top performers.



? WORK STRUCTURE



Flexible schedule



Deadline-driven



Accuracy > speed (but both matter)



? DO NOT APPLY IF:



You guess instead of verify



You fail to cite sources



You quit when records get messy



You confuse assumptions with facts



You dislike deep research



???? APPLICATION PROCESS (MANDATORY – NO EXCEPTIONS)

Complete this test:



????

Moderate D



Moderate C



Low S



Detail-oriented but decisive



???? STEP 2: VIDEO INTRODUCTION (REQUIRED)



Record a 2–3 minute video answering:



Your experience in genealogy or investigation



Types of cases you’ve handled



Tools you use regularly



How you verify you’ve found the right person



(Loom or Google Drive link)



???? STEP 3: WRITTEN CASE TEST (CRITICAL)

Locate summary



Case research outline

title: Inbound Sales & Dispatch Specialist
description:
(Growth Pathway to Sales Manager / Team Leader)



Company: Staff Connect (on behalf of our client)

Location: Remote – Philippines-based

Schedule: Rotating shifts between 5:00 PM – 9:00 AM AEDT

Employment Type: Full-time

Compensation: Competitive salary (based on experience and qualifications)

Leave: One week paid leave per year



About the Client



Our client is Australia’s largest misfuelling specialist, providing nationwide roadside assistance to motorists who a
 put the wrong fuel in their vehicle. When drivers are stressed and stranded, their team steps in to turn the situation around — quickly, professionally, and with empathy.



Staff Connect is supporting the client in building their first offshore team in the Philippines, offering a genuine opportunity for high performers to grow into leadership roles and eventually manage an entire offshore operation.



The Role

Inbound Sales & Dispatcher



Growth Pathway: Sales Manager / Team Leader



You will start in a frontline Inbound Sales & Dispatch role, handling incoming calls, assisting distressed customers, and coordinating technicians across Australia.



As you demonstrate strong sales ability, attention to detail, and initiative, you’ll progressively take on operations, quality control, and leadership responsibilities, with a clear pathway to advance into a Sales Manager / Team Leader position.



Key Responsibilities

Core Dispatch & Inbound Sales

- Act as the first point of contact for motorists who have misfuelled their vehicle.

- Use empathy and strong communication skills to convert inbound calls into confirmed bookings.

- Coordinate technicians nationwide using booking platforms and real-time tools.

- Collect deposits, log jobs accurately, and manage cases from start to completion.

- Communicate with customers and technicians via phone, Gmail, Slack, and SMS



Daily Operations & Quality Control

- Support fleet job closures, including managing long wait times when calling for PO numbers.

- Track spill kit usage by collecting all related
s and invoices in Xero (create only, do not send).

- Maintain accuracy in Xero and GeoOp, including:

- Reviewing previous day’s jobs for incomplete entries.

- Identifying jobs not properly closed or not sent to Xero.

- Perform call log clean-ups, ensuring:

- Objection reasons are correctly logged.

- ETAs, phone times, and job numbers are accurate.

- Sales opportunities are identified and closed.

- Discounts are properly logged and ticked.

- Act as a second set of eyes on GeoOp and call logs to catch errors, fill gaps, and prevent missed opportunities.



Documentation & Process Support

- Update fleet documents using new templates for consistency and clarity.

- Assist with process mapping, staff training, and continuous improvement initiatives.



Tech & Customer Support

- Coordinate servo runs and tech card runs to keep dispatch lines clear.

- Take ownership of escalated customer issues requiring extended phone support.

- Be comfortable being on camera during Slack huddles as part of daily operations.

- Participate in Slack huddles during shifts, including training, check-ins, and live support.



The Successful Candidate

- Minimum 2 years’ experience in a call centre, sales, or dispatch role.

- Proven success in sales conversion and customer service.

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Calm under pressure, with strong empathy for customers in stressful situations.

- Tech-savvy, with proficiency in Google Chrome, Gmail, and Google Workspace.

- Comfortable using Slack, including joining huddles and appearing on camera when required.

- Experience working from home with reliable internet and a quiet workspace.

- Bonus: Experience in automotive, roadside assistance, or mobile repair.

- Bonus: Knowledge of Australian geography.



What’s in It for You

- Fully remote, work-from-home role.

- Work with a growing international client.

- Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

- Clear career progression: Dispatcher ? Sales Manager / Team Leader.

- Supportive, professional team culture.

- Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

title: Paid Ads UGC Video Editor
description:
Join Blackboard Agency – Video Editor Wanted



At Blackboard, we create scroll-stopping, high-performing ads for some of the fastest-growing DTC and ecommerce brands. Our work blends data-driven strategy with stand-out creative, and now we’re looking for a Video Editor who knows how to turn raw creator footage into ads that actually convert.



Your Role



Edit UGC-style ads that stop the scroll and drive ROAS.



Add engaging text overlays, captions, and transitions that feel native to TikTok, IG Reels, and Meta Ads.



Optimise videos for platform-specific formats and placements.



Elevate pacing, music, and hooks to maximise conversions.



Collaborate with our creative strategists to test and iterate on performance-backed edits.



Who You Are



You’ve edited UGC ads for DTC/ecommerce brands before.



You understand social ad psychology – what makes someone stop, watch, and buy.



Skilled with Premiere Pro, After Effects, or similar tools.



Can edit fast without sacrificing quality.



Obsessed with the details that turn an ad from “just content” into a top performer.



Perks



Full-time remote role (40 hrs/week).



Competitive salary + performance bonuses.



Work on exciting global wellness, beauty, and lifestyle brands.



Be part of a fast-moving, results-driven agency with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



Send your portfolio & past UGC ad edits.



Use the subject line: “UGC Editor – Blackboard”. (Only these applications will be reviewed)



In 2–3 sentences, tell us why you’re the perfect fit.



Only send your best UGC work.



Apply now and help us create ads that don’t just look good – they perform.

title: Senior Customer Service Representative (Part-Time, Remote - E-commerce)
description:
Company: US-based E-commerce Brand?Hours: Part-Time (20–25 hours/week + )?Schedule: Must overlap with US business hours?Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)



Who This Role Is For

This role is for experienced e-commerce customer support professionals who have already worked inside Zendesk and directly managed fulfillment issues with a 3PL.

If you are new to customer service, still learning Zendesk, or have only handled chat/email without order systems, this role is not a fit.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

You will own customer support tickets end-to-end, not just reply to messages.

* Managing inbound support tickets in Zendesk

* Investigating shipping issues and providing accurate, timely resolutions

* Creating replacement orders directly in ShipBob

* Locating, verifying, and sending tracking numbers

* Resolving:

    * Lost or delayed shipments

    * Damaged or missing items

    * Fulfillment errors

* Communicating clearly and confidently with US-based customers

* Following SOPs while exercising judgment on edge cases

* Flagging trends or repeat issues to management



Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Applicants must meet all of the following:

? Zendesk experience (minimum 1+ year)?? E-commerce customer support experience?? Experience working with a 3PL (ShipBob strongly preferred)?? Excellent written English (clear, professional, and customer-friendly)?? Comfortable handling order systems, tracking tools, and dashboards?? Able to work independently with minimal supervision

? Ability to handle 200+ tickets in 3/4 hour shift efficiently without sacrificing quality

Applications that do not meet these requirements will not be considered.



Strong Advantages

* Direct ShipBob dashboard experience

* Shopify order management experience

* Prior support for US or EU brands

* Experience in SOP-driven, KPI-tracked environments





Tools You’ll Use

* Zendesk – primary ticketing system

* ShipBob – fulfillment, replacements, tracking

* Shopify – order reference

* iMessage / Google voice for team communication 



Compensation & Growth

* Competitive hourly rate based on experience

* Consistent weekly hours

* Opportunities for bonus if KPIs are met

* Opportunity to grow into expanded hours or senior ownership if performance is strong

title: Amazon Keepa Expert / Product Research VA (Keepa + Seller Central)
description:
Overview



We’re looking for a Keepa expert who can analyze Amazon products using Keepa charts + key metrics and provide profitable, low-risk leads. You must be confident reading price history, sales rank behavior, and identifying risks like IP complaints, restricted brands, and listing issues.



Key Responsibilities



Analyze products using Keepa (price history, rank history, offer count, buy box trends).



Confirm profitability using required inputs (cost, fees, shipping, prep, taxes when needed).



Identify risk factors:



IP/brand enforcement signals (aggressive brands, frequent takedowns).



Hazmat, meltable, restrictions/gating, brand approval needs.



Variation issues, bundle/multipack confusion, listing changes.



Check competition:



Offer count trends, Amazon in/out of stock patterns, buy box share behavior.



FBA vs FBM seller mix and fee impacts.



Deliver daily/weekly lead sheets with clear notes and screenshots:



ASIN, title, ROI %, profit $, sales rank, estimated sales, offer count, risk notes.



Follow sourcing rules (no restricted categories/brands as instructed).



Communicate clearly, respond quickly, and meet daily targets.



Required Skills



Strong ability to interpret Keepa charts, including:



Sales Rank drops and consistency



Buy Box history



New/Used price trends



Offer count changes



Amazon in-stock/out-of-stock patterns



Familiar with Amazon Seller Central basics (fees, restrictions, prep, FBA/FBM).



Comfortable using spreadsheets (Google Sheets/Excel).



High attention to detail and strong written English.



Preferred Tools (Nice to Have)



SellerAmp / RevSeller / Sellerboard / Jungle Scout (optional)



Tactical Arbitrage / Source Mogul (optional)



Basic understanding of Amazon policy risks (IP, authenticity, restricted brands)



Deliverables / Expectations



Provide X profitable leads per day (example: 5–10) that meet minimum criteria:



Minimum ROI: ___%



Minimum profit per unit: $___



Max sellers / max offer count: ___ (if required)



Must include Keepa screenshot + notes



Organized tracking sheet updated daily



Consistent communication and accuracy (low error rate)



Candidates must complete a short test:



Analyze 5 ASINs using Keepa



Provide: ROI/profit estimate, chart interpretation, risk notes, and final decision (buy/skip)



Pay



Hourly: $__4_/hr or



Per lead: $__1_ per qualified lead (valid, profitable, low-risk)



If you are this person please apply if not don't waste my timer and yours

title: Paid Search Strategist (Google Ads Certified)
description:
Paid Search Strategist



Salary: $3,200 USD per month

Schedule: Full time, U.S. PST hours

Location: Remote



Role Overview:



We are hiring a Paid Search Strategist to manage high volume paid search and YouTube campaigns for a U.S. marketing agency. This role owns campaign execution from setup through optimization, budget management, reporting, and delivering actionable insights aligned to client KPIs.



This is a client facing role that requires strong English communication, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently across multiple accounts.



Responsibilities:



- Manage high volume paid search and YouTube campaigns for multiple clients

- Set up, manage, and optimize paid search campaigns

- Maintain campaign budgets and pacing against defined CPA and CPC goals

- Identify campaign risks and optimization opportunities

- Engage in initial planning and ongoing optimization of SEM campaigns

- Develop and deliver reporting with actionable insights

- Build strong internal and external relationships

= Participate in client discussions related to performance and results

- Ensure campaigns align with client goals and expectations



Required Qualifications:



- Google Ads Certifications

- Three plus years experience managing high volume paid search campaigns

- Experience managing CPA and CPC driven campaigns

- Experience with Google Ads and YouTube campaigns

- Client facing experience with strong verbal and written English

- Ability to extract actionable insights from analytics tools

- Self starter with the ability to work independently

- Bachelor’s degree in a related field



Success Indicators:



- Campaigns meet or improve CPA and CPC targets

- Budgets are paced accurately with no surprises

- Clear, actionable insights are delivered through reporting

- Clients understand performance and trust recommendations

- Minimal oversight required after ramp up



Work Requirements:



- Professional, client ready English communication skills

- Ability to manage multiple accounts and deadlines

- Reliable internet connection and professional home setup



Benefits:



- Paid vacation, holiday, and sick leave after probation

- Bi-monthly payroll via Wise

- Dedicated Workspark support and onboarding

- Long term, stable role with a U.S. based team
